commit_message:
Exclude shared directories when creating environments

If we try to create a new environment from a shared configuration inside
the same repository, we can produce an infinite loop by copying the
environment into itself. Ignore any existing environments directory
during environment creation.

Change-Id: Ic9d3d03192f515a055e41351a0bf25da7a7b0684
Story: 2002009
Task: 40038

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-20 16:46:26.000000000', 'message': 'Make sure the policy upgrade check get a valid config

Placement does not use global CONF object. However when the policy
upgrade check was added in Ia7365cc3ae09e2ff916ab9f9ff0ba4fef0dc446b it
was referred to the global CONF object. However in placement it is not
initialized. Therefore the $ placement-status upgrade check fails with
oslo_config.cfg.NotInitializedError.

This patch makes sure that the policy upgrade check uses an initialized
config object instead.

Story: 2008831
Task: 42313

Change-Id: I7ef81df6ffa2eac96067b6c0370bd9792014e9cd
'}, {'created': '2021-04-21 09:16:59.000000000', 'message': 'Make sure the policy upgrade check get a valid config

Placement does not use global CONF object. However when the policy
upgrade check was added in Ia7365cc3ae09e2ff916ab9f9ff0ba4fef0dc446b it
was referred to the global CONF object. However in placement it is not
initialized. Therefore the $ placement-status upgrade check fails with
oslo_config.cfg.NotInitializedError.

This patch makes sure that the policy upgrade check uses an initialized
config object instead.

Story: 2008831
Task: 42313

Change-Id: I7ef81df6ffa2eac96067b6c0370bd9792014e9cd
'}]
commit_message:
Make sure the policy upgrade check get a valid config

Placement does not use global CONF object. However when the policy
upgrade check was added in Ia7365cc3ae09e2ff916ab9f9ff0ba4fef0dc446b it
was referred to the global CONF object. However in placement it is not
initialized. Therefore the $ placement-status upgrade check fails with
oslo_config.cfg.NotInitializedError.

This patch makes sure that the policy upgrade check uses an initialized
config object instead.

Story: 2008831
Task: 42313

Change-Id: I7ef81df6ffa2eac96067b6c0370bd9792014e9cd

subject: Set NetworkDeletionPolicy to retain
messages:
[{'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2021-04-22 03:35:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2021-04-22 04:23:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Don't we have to do a stack update with deletion_policy set to "RETAIN" before removing the resources?'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2021-04-22 04:31:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Don't we have to do a stack update with deletion_policy set to "RETAIN" before removing the resources?

The assumption is once we move to managing networks outside Heat, we set the deletion policy. The patch which caused the regression is problematic IMHO. We should manage the networks outside heat by default before we do these changes.'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2021-04-22 07:24:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2021-04-22 08:03:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2021-04-22 08:07:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2021-04-22 09:09:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I don't think this will work.

When the environment written by this module is used the network resources are already removed from the stack since we override OS::TripleO::Network with /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates/network/deployed_networks.yaml

The deletion policy of existing resources will not be updated since the resources are no longer in the stack template, and heat will use the deletion policy from the previous stack create|update."}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2021-04-22 10:12:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> When the environment written by this module is used the network resources are already removed from the stack since we override OS::TripleO::Network with /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates/network/deployed_networks.yaml

Yeah, we would be using deployed_networks.yaml and deletion_policy in the same update which won't work for us. But you can't remove the network resources managed by heat without changing the deletion_policy."}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2021-04-22 10:14:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2:
> 
> > When the environment written by this module is used the network resources are already removed from the stack since we override OS::TripleO::Network with /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates/network/deployed_networks.yaml
> 
> Yeah, we would be using deployed_networks.yaml and deletion_policy in the same update which won't work for us. But you can't remove the network resources managed by heat without changing the deletion_policy.

I think this thing is going to be a very messy upgrade."}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2021-04-22 10:29:03.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

DeletionPolicy has to be changed prior to (an earlier update) it being managed without heat. In the same update it won't work."}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2021-04-22 11:26:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2:
> 
> > Patch Set 2:
> > 
> > > When the environment written by this module is used the network resources are already removed from the stack since we override OS::TripleO::Network with /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates/network/deployed_networks.yaml
> > 
> > Yeah, we would be using deployed_networks.yaml and deletion_policy in the same update which won't work for us. But you can't remove the network resources managed by heat without changing the deletion_policy.
> 
> I think this thing is going to be a very messy upgrade.

The place to set the retention policy is in the environments/lifecycle/update-prepare.yaml and/or environments/lifecycle/upgrade-prepare.yaml. Or a new lifecycle environment used just for migrating the networks. After updating the stack with that, run overcloud network export to get a network_v2 data file, then overcloud provision networks with that data file. And finally stack update with the network_v2 file and the "deployed_networks" environment file which is generated by "overcloud provision networks".'}]

commit_message:
Set NetworkDeletionPolicy to retain

When managing network resources outside heat, set the
NetworkDeletionPolicy, else heat would try to delete
the resources, if they have previously been created
by Heat.

Related-Bug: #1925367
Change-Id: I8b8064188b41ba94886b4b0ec7ba2b1473a3a2ba

commit_message:
Add provider_physical_network option to private network

The vlan network provider, requires a physical network type, otherwise,
it will fail

Conflicts:
    tasks/tempest_resources.yml

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/779595
Change-Id: I021015709c8254ff5936ad08d61e1e02ab58c44f
(cherry picked from commit 24969898114dffc792bfc23a15f60875f4a647cf)

I approved it. If anyone disagrees we can revert it.'}, {'account_id': 10342, 'date': '2021-03-08 19:17:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Workflow-1

Stopping the merge of this. Made a discovery implementing this downstream which needs to be indicated in the spec.

Behavior today: as soon as the conductor manager gets an RPC to heartbeat, it spawns a thread to run task.driver.deploy.heartbeat, which means it can't return anything from that heartbeat driver method.

In order to implement this as written, we'll have to, if the config var is set and the microversion new enough, change the behavior to be sync. This may add significant complexity."}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2021-03-08 19:23:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: -Code-Review -Workflow

> Patch Set 7: Workflow-1
> 
> Stopping the merge of this. Made a discovery implementing this downstream which needs to be indicated in the spec.
> 
> Behavior today: as soon as the conductor manager gets an RPC to heartbeat, it spawns a thread to run task.driver.deploy.heartbeat, which means it can't return anything from that heartbeat driver method.
> 
> In order to implement this as written, we'll have to, if the config var is set and the microversion new enough, change the behavior to be sync. This may add significant complexity.

That is a lot of potential complexity possibly, but understandable/negotiable. Based on config *and* and I guess agent version the decision could be to run heartbeat in sync mode. Still doesn't change my high level perception of this that much."}, {'account_id': 10342, 'date': '2021-03-08 19:26:52.000000000', 'content': 'Removed Verified+2 by Zuul (22348)
'}, {'account_id': 10342, 'date': '2021-03-12 23:37:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 10342, 'date': '2021-03-18 22:20:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

recheck

commit_message:
No Conductor to IPA Communication spec

This spec proposes allowing deployers to optionally use /v1/heartbeat
to coordinate between Ironic conductor and IPA, instead of having to
use the IPA API directly.

Story: #2007765
Change-Id: I429dc46b8dc25a178013228cd8cf57aecb76eaf4

commit_message:
Delete Service VIPs prior to stack delete

When deleting an overcloud we should delete the
Service Virtual IP neutron resources created as
during deploy-steps playbook execution.

Closes-Bug: #1925367

subject: Increase OS_TEST_TIMEOUT to 1200
messages:
[{'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2021-04-01 10:38:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2021-04-01 10:39:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

This change is ready for review.'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2021-04-01 15:20:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Looks like we increased it from 600 to 900 a scant seven months ago, but if we're still seeing some individual tests taking longer than 15 minutes to complete then I suppose this might help. Of course, if those tests are taking that long because they get stuck in a deadlock or something, it doesn't matter how long you make the timeout, all you're doing is increasing the time it takes to report failure."}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-04-22 09:02:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

Change-Id: I1915a4992c3e98c01d77d7feb72ddf6e8e383f09
'}]
commit_message:
Increase OS_TEST_TIMEOUT to 1200

We do not want to timeout just because installation of packages got
bit slower.

See: https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/e14185c56a0f495ca21c3afd0c67a7aa
Change-Id: I1915a4992c3e98c01d77d7feb72ddf6e8e383f09

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-20 01:37:49.000000000', 'message': "Use py3 as the default runtime for tox

Moving on py3 as the default runtime for tox to avoid to update this at
each new cycle.

Wallaby support officially the following runtimes [1]:
- Python 3.6
- Python 3.8

During Victoria Python 3.7 was used as the default runtime [2] however this
version isn't longer officially supported.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/wallaby.html#python-runtimes-for-wallaby
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/victoria.html#python-runtimes-for-victoria

Change-Id: Ic55a211381b901f2203988c0fac4e7545666f382
"}]
commit_message:
Use py3 as the default runtime for tox

Moving on py3 as the default runtime for tox to avoid to update this at
each new cycle.

Wallaby support officially the following runtimes [1]:
- Python 3.6
- Python 3.8

During Victoria Python 3.7 was used as the default runtime [2] however this
version isn't longer officially supported.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/wallaby.html#python-runtimes-for-wallaby
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/victoria.html#python-runtimes-for-victoria

Change-Id: Ic55a211381b901f2203988c0fac4e7545666f382

commit_message:
Remove grenade jobs from old stable branches

As discussed and approved during the ironic wallaby midcycle, the grenade
jobs in old stable branches, starting from EM branches and up the oldest
not-EM (at this moment train) are removed.

And remove lower-constraints job.

Change-Id: If1a785dc1696537be65f16cb514db0390d65f6e9

commit_message:
CI: switch to quay.io for container images

Based on the discussions from recent Kolla meetings [1][2][3],
we established that, to avoid the DockerHub pull limit issues
in our CI, we will try using quay.io.

The images have already been published via Kolla CI
for master/Wallaby [4] and Victoria [5].

This change applies only to CI.
The user-facing move is yet to be discussed.

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/kolla/2021/kolla.2021-03-17-15.00.log.html#l-102
[2] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/kolla/2021/kolla.2021-03-24-15.00.log.html#l-137
[3] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/kolla/2021/kolla.2021-03-31-15.01.log.html#l-50
[4] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla/+/781130
[5] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla/+/781899

See related Kolla Ansible change
I22e11a994801447526ac26fc2815a1679876225e

Change-Id: Id6690dc9a486af0ed7d42555d84cf77d6de0b6af

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-20 18:28:48.000000000', 'message': "Handle repositories with a default branch other than master

This commit adds a new configuration option `default_branch`, which is
used to specify the default/base branch a repository is using.
Previously reno assumed the default branch was always named 'master'
which causes commands such as 'reno lint' to fail when it is run on a
repository that uses a different default branch name such as 'main'.
This config option gives users an option to specify which branch should
be used for cases like that.

Change-Id: I08f258206290fdc1dcb9fcfc078e30384667c925
"}]
commit_message:
Handle repositories with a default branch other than master

This commit adds a new configuration option `default_branch`, which is
used to specify the default/base branch a repository is using.
Previously reno assumed the default branch was always named 'master'
which causes commands such as 'reno lint' to fail when it is run on a
repository that uses a different default branch name such as 'main'.
This config option gives users an option to specify which branch should
be used for cases like that.

Change-Id: I08f258206290fdc1dcb9fcfc078e30384667c925

commit_message:
Use global dhcp_domain by default

Set neutron_dns_domain to the `dhcp_domain` value by default.

It is convenient to use signle variable to adjust DHCP domain
configuration across services

Change-Id: I355078189598726e0fe349c7ee2320487cfc0e7a

commit_message:
[goal] Deprecate the JSON formatted policy file

As per the community goal of migrating the policy file
the format from JSON to YAML[1], we need to replace policy.json to
policy.yaml and remove deprecated policy.json.

config_template has been choosen instead of the copy, since it can
properly handle content that has been lookuped.

We make a separate task not to restart service when it's not needed.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/wallaby/migrate-policy-format-from-json-to-yaml.html

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible/+/787199
Change-Id: Idd28e5df99bfcf51bad2b785be41221eb0fe5142

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-21 03:14:02.000000000', 'message': "Introducing default_tls_verify

TLS client verification used to be accidentally disabled in libvirt.
This was fixed in libvirt-6.10.0-1.
Which means, once you're using libvirt-6.10.0-1 or higher, a client
certificate is mandatory during live migration with TLS.

If we simply create the client certificate, this will fix live-migration
of newly created instance but will not fix already created instances.

This change will allow us to keep client certificate validation disabled
during the train release cycle and re-enable it from Wallaby and onward.

Related-Change: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/785438/
Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1945760
Change-Id: I628e5ef0a50799e44145fe4ed78303d0fdbf5838

(cherry picked from commit 2d198362d277e24d511109fb2a4c19977ca3b7fc)
(cherry picked from commit b82062fc2e7fb6df5974a092c55ce1f5f4184091)
"}]
commit_message:
Introducing default_tls_verify

TLS client verification used to be accidentally disabled in libvirt.
This was fixed in libvirt-6.10.0-1.
Which means, once you're using libvirt-6.10.0-1 or higher, a client
certificate is mandatory during live migration with TLS.

If we simply create the client certificate, this will fix live-migration
of newly created instance but will not fix already created instances.

This change will allow us to keep client certificate validation disabled
during the train release cycle and re-enable it from Wallaby and onward.

Related-Change: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/785438/
Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1945760
Change-Id: I628e5ef0a50799e44145fe4ed78303d0fdbf5838
(cherry picked from commit e28a1b8b70b97820fa99d0a33f594801d42211a2)
(cherry picked from commit e046a3bf633f310650fefe54abfb2142703c230a)
(cherry picked from commit 2d198362d277e24d511109fb2a4c19977ca3b7fc)
(cherry picked from commit b82062fc2e7fb6df5974a092c55ce1f5f4184091)

subject: Drop support for py27
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 5263, 'name': 'Jeremy Stanley', 'display_name': 'fungi', 'email': 'fungi@yuggoth.org', 'username': 'fungi', 'status': 'missing, presumed fed'}, {'_account_id': 15334, 'name': 'Stephen Finucane', 'display_name': 'stephenfin', 'email': 'stephenfin@redhat.com', 'username': 'sfinucan'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 24162, 'name': 'Sorin Sbârnea', 'display_name': 'zbr', 'email': 'ssbarnea@redhat.com', 'username': 'ssbarnea', 'status': 'do not feed the troll 🥕'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2021-04-06 12:12:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2021-04-06 13:25:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

This change is ready for review.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2021-04-06 14:52:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

This has been proposed in the past, but there was still the desire to keep py27 support since pbr is used for other things. That said, it's been awhile since py27 went EOL, so I think it is worth revisiting that decision."}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2021-04-06 15:21:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> This has been proposed in the past, but there was still the desire to keep py27 support since pbr is used for other things. That said, it's been awhile since py27 went EOL, so I think it is worth revisiting that decision.

As we can always branch old pbt into a `stable/5.x` branch in order to path py27 support, it should be safe go this way.

Dropping support for old python does not mean all py27 users are now broken. Worst case scenario is that they will have to add a `pbr<6` condition."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2021-04-06 15:24:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Dropping support for old python does not mean all py27 users are now broken. Worst case scenario is that they will have to add a `pbr<6` condition.

I think the argument was that by the nature of pbr, doing something like that wasn't always possible. But let's wait for someone more familiar with the situation to chime in."}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2021-04-06 16:53:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I strongly oppose this. It's pain for users. pbr isn't pinnable - its backwards compat contract has to be *significantly* stronger than most normal software."}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2021-04-06 16:54:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

The argument in facor of retaining old Python support for new releases of PBR is that, because it's a setup_requires, it must be installed directly by Setuptools which can't control what version of PBR it obtains, particularly older systems with older Setuptools versions, which are the places most likely to also be running older Python interpreters. Even if all projects using PBR stop supporting Python 2.7, their old versions may still be used with it, and need latest PBR to continue working with that interpreter.

I'm not sure where we draw the line on breaking pip install of old packages on old Python interpreters, probably there's a long tail of systems in that state and at some point we will necessarily need to cut them off and tell them to find a workaround (e.g. manual preinstallation of old PBR in a virtualenv before asking pip to install some package which uses PBR)."}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2021-04-06 17:10:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

This will not happen.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-04-22 09:09:41.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

Require py35 or newer.

Change-Id: I3bebce62dfa92187af373a890ac661439b4faf84
'}]

@Marcin: you said something about moving back to distro-provided rmq - would be worthwile to check how it behaves in deploys and upgrades in CI - I checked that, with bullseye, we would have 3.8 in all distros - that's what we wanted so we can try that path and perhaps be happier"}, {'account_id': 24072, 'date': '2021-04-15 19:38:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I am fine with both external rabbitmq and erlang as long as it is as same as possible version everywhere.

In-distro version of rabbitmq is older than external in all cases (3.8.[239]).

The other thing is with Erlang. CentOS has 22.3, Debian/bullseye has 23.2, Ubuntu has 22.2 version. We want 23.x as RabbitMQ will abandon support for Erlang 22 in May 2021.

So for now we need external RabbitMQ for all distros/archs (it is arch:all). External Erlang is needed for CentOS/Ubuntu - Debian 'bullseye' can use either external or distro one ('buster' needs external).

We probably need to pin down rabbitmq in all branches starting with Wallaby to have 3.8.14 maximum."}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2021-04-16 07:37:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Published edit on patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 24072, 'date': '2021-04-16 08:06:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Review-Priority+1'}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2021-04-16 09:14:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Published edit on patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2021-04-19 07:32:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Upgrade CI is fried because Nova merged an X cycle change to allow only Wallaby computes... so master is Xena, not Wallaby.'}, {'account_id': 24072, 'date': '2021-04-20 06:57:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

RabbitMQ team suggests using Erlang from either Launchpad PPA (support for Ubuntu and Debian) or cloudsmith. 

Please consider move to using PPA - we will get aarch64 packages as well.'}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2021-04-20 07:56:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2021-04-20 07:58:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Patch Set 6 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2021-04-20 08:35:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Published edit on patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 24072, 'date': '2021-04-20 13:52:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-04-20 16:42:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

something wrong with the installed ones..."}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2021-04-21 08:21:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 24072, 'date': '2021-04-21 09:47:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Code-Review+2

I am generally fine with this but then what is the point of us downloading the key if it cannot be used and must be redownloaded? Perhaps we need something similar to what Marcin is doing for Debuntu - download the keys, store them in the right place, and then link to them in repo files? WDYT?'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-04-21 11:42:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

I meant ~> https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla/+/784923'}, {'account_id': 24072, 'date': '2021-04-21 11:55:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

The common way of doing stuff for CentOS was "fetch repo file as provided, disable it, use" - no edits other than disabling repo. And then importing needed keys.

So fetch repo files as they are given by upstream, disable, add keys. No extra mangling needed.

RPM files are signed and we need those keys.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-04-21 12:48:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

Some context here in the switch from 3.7 in packagecloud to 3.8 in bintray: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla/+/694799/37/docker/base/rabbitmq_rabbitmq-server.repo'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-04-21 13:20:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13:

So I guess just disable the repo_gpgcheck and have it clean. Then we don't need more gpg keys either! Win-win."}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2021-04-21 14:30:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13:

commit_message:
rabbitmq: Move to packagecloud

bintray is being shut down 1st of May 2021, rabbitmq docs direct
users to packagecloud - so let's move.

Change-Id: I499251d13ca77aea2215f8a879b7bb8dd51f1c9f

commit_message:
[release] Add explicit source version pins (Wallaby)

Some source packages are not referencing the ${openstack_branch}
configuration variable, so we must pin them manually. Some other
packages do not have stable branches, so we take the latest version at
the time of release.

Change-Id: I51038bf24642e319a8a996a1ed725240264d3352

'}, {'created': '2020-12-16 16:56:36.000000000', 'message': 'Do not use fecth with become in transfer_data role

As stated in the official ansible docs[0]:

When running fetch with become, the slurp module will also
be used to fetch the contents of the file for determining
the remote checksum. This effectively doubles the transfer
size, and depending on the file size can consume all available
memory on the remote or local hosts causing a MemoryError.
Due to this it is advisable to run this module without become
whenever possible.

This is mostly problematic when transfering big files and the
/var/lib/mysql folder tends to be big in long deployments.

This patch removes the become from the fetch task and changes
the archive permissions before the fetch in order to make it
possible. To cover this functionality a new test is added
huge_file which creates a 10G file in the source container,
as well as updates some molecule specific parameters which
were outdated.

Closes-Bug: #1908425
Resolves: rhbz#1904681

[0] - https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/collections/ansible/builtin/fetch_module.html#notes
Change-Id: I15c2d242cd1f470fa8c4b364e011a5f9a3111945

commit_message:
Do not use fetch with become in transfer_data role

As stated in the official ansible docs[0]:

When running fetch with become, the slurp module will also
be used to fetch the contents of the file for determining
the remote checksum. This effectively doubles the transfer
size, and depending on the file size can consume all available
memory on the remote or local hosts causing a MemoryError.
Due to this it is advisable to run this module without become
whenever possible.

This is mostly problematic when transfering big files and the
/var/lib/mysql folder tends to be big in long deployments.

This patch removes the become from the fetch task and changes
the archive permissions before the fetch in order to make it
possible. To cover this functionality a new test is added
huge_file which creates a 10G file in the source container,
as well as updates some molecule specific parameters which
were outdated.

Closes-Bug: #1908425
Resolves: rhbz#1904681

[0] - https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/collections/ansible/builtin/fetch_module.html#notes
Change-Id: I15c2d242cd1f470fa8c4b364e011a5f9a3111945

commit_message:
Set buster jobs to NV

Since nova requires libvirt version 6.0.0 or greater, we can not support
buster anymore.

Bullseye image is not present in infra yet so we can't just switch to it

Change-Id: I94223c50b948f605bf7fd7ed606621cae145460b

[{'created': '2021-04-08 10:16:36.000000000', 'message': 'Superfluous arg removed

The --branches arg of the initial coverage binary call
was unnecessary, due to presence of the relevant setting in
.coveragerc settings file.

Therefore it was removed.

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I59600d3b68febc1de195640aacfe2bcf50012069

was unnecessary, due to presence of the relevant setting in
.coveragerc settings file.

Therefore it was removed.

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I59600d3b68febc1de195640aacfe2bcf50012069
'}, {'created': '2021-04-13 12:11:48.000000000', 'message': 'Superfluous arg removed

The --branches arg of the initial coverage binary call
was unnecessary, due to presence of the relevant setting

commit_message:
Superfluous arg removed

The --branches arg of the initial coverage binary call
was unnecessary, due to presence of the relevant setting in
the .coveragerc settings file.

Therefore it was removed.

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I59600d3b68febc1de195640aacfe2bcf50012069

commit_message:
Introducing default_tls_verify

TLS client verification used to be accidentally disabled in libvirt.
This was fixed in libvirt-6.10.0-1.
Which means, once you're using libvirt-6.10.0-1 or higher, a client
certificate is mandatory during live migration with TLS.

If we simply create the client certificate, this will fix live-migration
of newly created instance but will not fix already created instances.

This change will allow us to keep client certificate validation disabled
during the train release cycle and re-enable it from Wallaby and onward.

Related-Change: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/785438/
Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1945760
Change-Id: I628e5ef0a50799e44145fe4ed78303d0fdbf5838
(cherry picked from commit e28a1b8b70b97820fa99d0a33f594801d42211a2)
(cherry picked from commit e046a3bf633f310650fefe54abfb2142703c230a)
(cherry picked from commit 2d198362d277e24d511109fb2a4c19977ca3b7fc)

commit_message:
Drop lower-constraints job

We facing errors related to the new pip resolver, this
topic was discussed on the ML and QA team proposed to
to test lower-constraints [1].

I propose to drop this job because the complexity and recurring pain needed
to maintain that now exceeds the benefits provided by this mechanismes, and
We need to drop the lower-constraints.txt file as well as the corresponding
tox target

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-December/019390.html

Change-Id: Ib0ef1fadf4fe44f1d6af2f7d542b8af919652501

commit_message:
Support bytes type in generate_public_ID()

python-ldap3.0 or later running on python3 uses str or bytes
data type according to what fields are returned.
local_id may be a bytes data type.
To handle it properly, mapping[key] needs to be examined for
identifying its data type and what python version is used.

Closes-Bug: #1901654
Change-Id: Iac097235fd31e166028c169d14ec0937c663c21c
(cherry picked from commit f7df9fba828328d8b20e85d711c1d27c77089632)
(cherry picked from commit 5b860e0b3b4e318b91325996156bae3f99abd6c7)
(cherry picked from commit f4819fe36f087b2f652dc68fd33880860570f8d9)

commit_message:
Introducing default_tls_verify

TLS client verification used to be accidentally disabled in libvirt.
This was fixed in libvirt-6.10.0-1.
Which means, once you're using libvirt-6.10.0-1 or higher, a client
certificate is mandatory during live migration with TLS.

If we simply create the client certificate, this will fix live-migration
of newly created instance but will not fix already created instances.

This change will allow us to keep client certificate validation disabled
during the train release cycle and re-enable it from Wallaby and onward.

Related-Change: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/785438/
Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1945760

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-16 10:51:32.000000000', 'message': 'Fix undercloud install/upgrade stomping hosts

After a Overcloud deployment, /etc/hosts on the undercloud
will be populated with entries for each overcloud node. Since
we use the same tripleo_ansible roles for both the undercloud
and overcloud deployment, the /etc/hosts file on the Director
will be removed by undercloud install / upgrade operations.

This is outlined here:
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1933528

This change passes the Environment variable TRIPLEO_PLAN_NAME
to the Ansible task. We then use this in a related change to

commit_message:
Fix undercloud install/upgrade stomping hosts

After a Overcloud deployment, /etc/hosts on the undercloud
will be populated with entries for each overcloud node. Since
we use the same tripleo_ansible roles for both the undercloud
and overcloud deployment, the /etc/hosts file on the Director
will be removed by undercloud install / upgrade operations.

This is outlined here:
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1933528

This change passes the Environment variable TRIPLEO_PLAN_NAME
to the Ansible task. We then use this in a related change to
the tripleo_hosts_entries role in the tripleo-ansible repo.

Closes-Bug: #1924751
RHBZ: 1933528
Change-Id: Iff59f1a21966f15facd2950c64f2fd507bfb488a

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-26 17:47:00.000000000', 'message': "Retry update_user when sqlalchemy raises StaleDataErrors

Keystone's update_user() method in the SQL driver processes a lot of
information about how to update users. This includes evaluating password
logic and authentication attempts for PSI-DSS. This logic is evaluated
after keystone pulls the user record from SQL and before it exits the
context manager, which performs the write.

When multiple clients are all updating the same user reference, it's
more likely they will see an HTTP 500 because of race conditions exiting
the context manager. The HTTP 500 is due to stale data when updating
password expiration for old passwords, which happens when setting a new
password for a user.

This commit attempts to handle that case more gracefully than throwing a
500 by detecting StaleDataErrors from sqlalchemy and retrying.  The
identity sql backend will retry the request for clients that have
stale data change from underneath them.

Change-Id: I75590c20e90170ed862f46f0de7d61c7810b5c90
Closes-Bug: 1885753
(cherry picked from commit 6b581bfe43811379e9ceea2770242f05f0c9fa66)
(cherry picked from commit 22119176d612d4441d9cf25e76adde52ec4f88e2)

more likely they will see an HTTP 500 because of race conditions exiting
the context manager. The HTTP 500 is due to stale data when updating
password expiration for old passwords, which happens when setting a new
password for a user.

This commit attempts to handle that case more gracefully than throwing a
500 by detecting StaleDataErrors from sqlalchemy and retrying.  The
identity sql backend will retry the request for clients that have
stale data change from underneath them.

Change-Id: I75590c20e90170ed862f46f0de7d61c7810b5c90
Closes-Bug: 1885753
(cherry picked from commit ceae3566e83b26fd6a1679154eae9b0cef29da64)
(cherry picked from commit f47e635b8041542faa05e64606e66d2fbbc5f284)
(cherry picked from commit 5b7d4c80d484262018f937083050844648f07a11)

commit_message:
Retry update_user when sqlalchemy raises StaleDataErrors

Keystone's update_user() method in the SQL driver processes a lot of
information about how to update users. This includes evaluating password
logic and authentication attempts for PSI-DSS. This logic is evaluated
after keystone pulls the user record from SQL and before it exits the
context manager, which performs the write.

When multiple clients are all updating the same user reference, it's
more likely they will see an HTTP 500 because of race conditions exiting
the context manager. The HTTP 500 is due to stale data when updating
password expiration for old passwords, which happens when setting a new
password for a user.

This commit attempts to handle that case more gracefully than throwing a
500 by detecting StaleDataErrors from sqlalchemy and retrying.  The
identity sql backend will retry the request for clients that have
stale data change from underneath them.

Change-Id: I75590c20e90170ed862f46f0de7d61c7810b5c90
Closes-Bug: 1885753
(cherry picked from commit ceae3566e83b26fd6a1679154eae9b0cef29da64)
(cherry picked from commit f47e635b8041542faa05e64606e66d2fbbc5f284)
(cherry picked from commit 5b7d4c80d484262018f937083050844648f07a11)

commit_message:
Configure branch on which tripleo jobs should be run

Those jobs are run in the periodic queue and it seems that they are
using neutron from the last stable release instead of master.
So this patch sets explicitly master branch to be used.

Change-Id: Ibef0c6f33f68394797d623ced709e079fe6e22e0
Closes-Bug: #1923201

With this change, we lose the ability to remap OS::TripleO::Network::Ports::RedisVipPort and OS::TripleO::Network::Ports::OVNDBsVipPort via the resource registry. We do document doing that in conjuction with DeployedServerPortMap to noop the Neutron ports. We do need the ability to set any IP (on any subnet) for these VIP's without talking to Neutron.

I'd like to understand what the plan is around the other VIP's as well. I don't think I see patches up to convert those over to use tripleo_service_vip, but is that the plan?

If not, why the inconsistency between these vips and the remaining ones?"}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2021-03-08 19:58:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1
> 
> With this change, we lose the ability to remap OS::TripleO::Network::Ports::RedisVipPort and OS::TripleO::Network::Ports::OVNDBsVipPort via the resource registry. We do document doing that in conjuction with DeployedServerPortMap to noop the Neutron ports. We do need the ability to set any IP (on any subnet) for these VIP's without talking to Neutron.
> 

I think we should consider a validation stopping the deployment in case OS::TripleO::Network::Ports::RedisVipPort or OS::TripleO::Network::Ports::OVNDBsVipPort is in the resource_registry. And point to a doc explaining how to move forward.

The ansible module will echo back whatever IP you specified in case the neutron service is not available. So instead of the resource_registry override you'd set:
  RedisVirtualFixedIPs: [{'ip_address':'1.2.3.4'}]
  OVNDBsVirtualFixedIPs: [{'ip_address':'1.2.3.4'}]

This gives us one parameter to set a fixed IP address for these VIPs no matter if neutron is used or not.

You would also have to configure the ServiceNetMap properly for the FixedIPs to function properly in the case where neutron is available, i.e there must be a subnet with a cidr that includes the specified ip address.

The ansible module will also fall back to the 'ctlplane_virtual_ip' if the network for the service is 'ctlplane' in the ServiceNetMap replacing the current "noop" default.

> I'd like to understand what the plan is around the other VIP's as well. I don't think I see patches up to convert those over to use tripleo_service_vip, but is that the plan?
> 
> If not, why the inconsistency between these vips and the remaining ones?

These VIPs are service specific, we only need them if deploying the service Redis or OVN. So IMO it makes sense to leave it to the service to set it up. I plan to do something similar with OVN's OVNMacAddressNetwork stuff.

The other VIPs are'nt service specific, they are "network" centric. So I think we should manage those VIPs as part of the network provisioning workflow.'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2021-03-08 21:31:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> Patch Set 4:
> 
> > Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1
> > 
> > With this change, we lose the ability to remap OS::TripleO::Network::Ports::RedisVipPort and OS::TripleO::Network::Ports::OVNDBsVipPort via the resource registry. We do document doing that in conjuction with DeployedServerPortMap to noop the Neutron ports. We do need the ability to set any IP (on any subnet) for these VIP's without talking to Neutron.
> > 
> 
> I think we should consider a validation stopping the deployment in case OS::TripleO::Network::Ports::RedisVipPort or OS::TripleO::Network::Ports::OVNDBsVipPort is in the resource_registry. And point to a doc explaining how to move forward.

I'd probably be ok with that, as long as there is a way to move forward with equivalent functionality to what we have now. Presently, we can choose to create or not create a Neutron port for these VIP's, regardless of whether Neutron is actually available or not. We can also specify the VIP from any subnet (Neutron managed or not), again, regardless of whether neutron is available.

> 
> The ansible module will echo back whatever IP you specified in case the neutron service is not available. So instead of the resource_registry override you'd set:
>   RedisVirtualFixedIPs: [{'ip_address':'1.2.3.4'}]
>   OVNDBsVirtualFixedIPs: [{'ip_address':'1.2.3.4'}]

If we do end up making this change, can we fix the parameter values? Is there a reason why we would have to continue to enforce the json list/dict structure around the actual IP value?

> 
> This gives us one parameter to set a fixed IP address for these VIPs no matter if neutron is used or not.
> 
> You would also have to configure the ServiceNetMap properly for the FixedIPs to function properly in the case where neutron is available, i.e there must be a subnet with a cidr that includes the specified ip address.

That doesn't give us what we have with DeployedServerPortMap today, which is basically a way to specify any IP for any of resources that can map to deployed-neutron-port.yaml.

> 
> The ansible module will also fall back to the 'ctlplane_virtual_ip' if the network for the service is 'ctlplane' in the ServiceNetMap replacing the current "noop" default.
> 
> > I'd like to understand what the plan is around the other VIP's as well. I don't think I see patches up to convert those over to use tripleo_service_vip, but is that the plan?
> > 
> > If not, why the inconsistency between these vips and the remaining ones?
> 
> These VIPs are service specific, we only need them if deploying the service Redis or OVN. So IMO it makes sense to leave it to the service to set it up. I plan to do something similar with OVN's OVNMacAddressNetwork stuff.
> 
> The other VIPs are'nt service specific, they are "network" centric. So I think we should manage those VIPs as part of the network provisioning workflow.

Ok, I wasn't sure if it was still the plan to decouple the Heat->Neutron interaction for managing these VIPs as well. I think it needs to be decoupled so that Heat never has to talk to the Neutron API.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2021-03-08 21:47:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> Patch Set 4:
> 
> > Patch Set 4:
> > 
> > > Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1
> > > 
> > > With this change, we lose the ability to remap OS::TripleO::Network::Ports::RedisVipPort and OS::TripleO::Network::Ports::OVNDBsVipPort via the resource registry. We do document doing that in conjuction with DeployedServerPortMap to noop the Neutron ports. We do need the ability to set any IP (on any subnet) for these VIP's without talking to Neutron.
> > > 
> > 
> > I think we should consider a validation stopping the deployment in case OS::TripleO::Network::Ports::RedisVipPort or OS::TripleO::Network::Ports::OVNDBsVipPort is in the resource_registry. And point to a doc explaining how to move forward.
> 
> I'd probably be ok with that, as long as there is a way to move forward with equivalent functionality to what we have now. Presently, we can choose to create or not create a Neutron port for these VIP's, regardless of whether Neutron is actually available or not. We can also specify the VIP from any subnet (Neutron managed or not), again, regardless of whether neutron is available.
> 

Ok, currently it will only allow setting "anything" with 0 validation as it can be done with deployed_neutron_port in the case when neutron is'nt available.

> > 
> > The ansible module will echo back whatever IP you specified in case the neutron service is not available. So instead of the resource_registry override you'd set:
> >   RedisVirtualFixedIPs: [{'ip_address':'1.2.3.4'}]
> >   OVNDBsVirtualFixedIPs: [{'ip_address':'1.2.3.4'}]
> 
> If we do end up making this change, can we fix the parameter values? Is there a reason why we would have to continue to enforce the json list/dict structure around the actual IP value?
> 

I guess Heat would accept '1.2.3.4' as a comma separated list as well. And we could make the update the ansible-module to support both the list/dict stucture and just an IP. I guess the list/dict structure was put there because it mirrors neutron, less data transformation hassles.

I wonder if allowing a boolean flag to enable/disable use of neutron would make sense, to address your desire to just specify anything.
Something like:
  RedisVirtualFixedIPs: [{'ip_address':'1.2.3.4', 'use_neutron': false}]

wdyt? (I'm open to suggestions.)

> > The other VIPs are'nt service specific, they are "network" centric. So I think we should manage those VIPs as part of the network provisioning workflow.
> 
> Ok, I wasn't sure if it was still the plan to decouple the Heat->Neutron interaction for managing these VIPs as well. I think it needs to be decoupled so that Heat never has to talk to the Neutron API.

Yeah, I was kind of hoping we could hack it with a custom heat resource that would work for the create only mode of ephemeral Heat, so that users are'nt overwhelmed with another UX change. But I understand from Rabi's feedback on that patch that ephemeral Heat won't be able to talk to anything keystone, neutron etc. So, yes I'll work out a way for the other VIPs as well.'}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2021-03-08 22:02:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2021-03-08 22:06:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow-1

at a minimum, it needs a docs update in deploy-guide/source/features/deployed_server.rst and a release note.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2021-03-25 03:07:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8: Patch Set 7 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2021-03-25 22:51:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2021-03-25 22:59:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

> Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1
> 
> this is an interface breakage. are we ok with that?
> 
> at a minimum, it needs a docs update in deploy-guide/source/features/deployed_server.rst and a release note.

I added a releasenote.

I've proposed a tripleoclient patch to detect use of the removed interfaces, it will raise InvalidConfiguration if used.


I'm not sure what to do about the docs:
  https://docs.openstack.org/project-deploy-guide/tripleo-docs/latest/features/deployed_server.html#network-configuration

Using a deployed-neutron-port override isn't a requirement for using deployed server. If the resource registry interfaces wasn't overridden the heat stack would simply create the neutron resources?

Should the section on Redis and OVNDBs VIPs be removed from that doc?"}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2021-03-25 23:27:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

> Patch Set 9:
> 
> > Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1
> >

> >

> 
> I added a releasenote.
> 
> I've proposed a tripleoclient patch to detect use of the removed interfaces, it will raise InvalidConfiguration if used.
> 
> 
> I'm not sure what to do about the docs:
>   https://docs.openstack.org/project-deploy-guide/tripleo-docs/latest/features/deployed_server.html#network-configuration
> 
> Using a deployed-neutron-port override isn't a requirement for using deployed server. If the resource registry interfaces wasn't overridden the heat stack would simply create the neutron resources?
> 
> Should the section on Redis and OVNDBs VIPs be removed from that doc?

Doc's patch proposed:
  https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-docs/+/783121

And, the tripleoclient patch (I forgot to reference it in the previous comment):
  https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/python-tripleoclient/+/779377"}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2021-03-26 02:11:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10: Patch Set 9 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2021-03-26 09:38:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2021-03-29 07:54:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

Tested this and was able to use a separate ovn-dbs vip in my bgp env (previously I was not able to do this at all). So with this review and:
+  OVNDBsVirtualFixedIPs:
+    - ip_address: 172.31.0.2
+      use_neutron: false

I got the two VIPs working:
[root@ctrl-1-0 ~]# pcs status |grep ip-
  * ip-172.31.0.1       (ocf::heartbeat:IPaddr2):        Started ctrl-1-0
  * ip-172.31.0.2       (ocf::heartbeat:IPaddr2):        Started ctrl-2-0

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-23 23:06:44.000000000', 'message': 'Refactor Service VIPs redis and ovn_dbs

With this change a Heat resource is no longer used to
create an undercloud neutron API port resource for the
redis and ovn_dbs service virtual IPs. Instead an
external deploy task at step 0 in the individual service
template uses the "tripleo_service_vip" ansible module
to mange a neutron API port resource for each service.

The interfaces to control the IP address and service
network (RedisVirtualFixedIPs, OVNDBsVirtualFixedIPs
and ServiceNetMap) remains the same.

NOTE: If the neutron service is not available the
      tripleo_service_vip ansible module will "echo"
      the IP provided in %service%VirtualFixedIPs.

Related: blueprint network-data-v2-ports
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/777257
Change-Id: I4794418546363888e7a555a16b45b7a4417f1ef8

'}, {'created': '2021-03-11 00:34:32.000000000', 'message': 'Refactor Service VIPs redis and ovn_dbs

With this change a Heat resource is no longer used to
create an undercloud neutron API port resource for the
redis and ovn_dbs service virtual IPs. Instead an
external deploy task at step 0 in the individual service
template uses the "tripleo_service_vip" ansible module
to mange a neutron API port resource for each service.

The interfaces to control the IP address and service
network (RedisVirtualFixedIPs, OVNDBsVirtualFixedIPs
and ServiceNetMap) remains the same.

It is also possible to include the 'use_neutron' boolean
in the FixedIPs parameter to instruct the ansible module
not to create a neutron API resource, and simply "echo"
the ip_address given in the FixedIPs parameter. For
example:
  RedisVirtualFixedIPs:
    - ip_address: 1.0.0.5
      use_neutron: false

Alternatively the fixed-ips can be set using the
'ServiceVips' parameter, like this:

 ServiceVips:
   redis: 1.0.0.5
   ovs_dbs: 1.0.0.6

NOTE: If the neutron service is not available the
      tripleo_service_vip ansible module will "echo"
      the IP provided in %service%VirtualFixedIPs.

Related: blueprint network-data-v2-ports

commit_message:
Refactor Service VIPs redis and ovn_dbs

With this change a Heat resource is no longer used to
create an undercloud neutron API port resource for the
redis and ovn_dbs service virtual IPs. Instead an
external deploy task at step 0 in the individual service
template uses the "tripleo_service_vip" ansible module
to mange a neutron API port resource for each service.

The interfaces to control the IP address and service
network (RedisVirtualFixedIPs, OVNDBsVirtualFixedIPs
and ServiceNetMap) remains the same.

It is also possible to include the 'use_neutron' boolean
in the FixedIPs parameter to instruct the ansible module
not to create a neutron API resource, and simply "echo"
the ip_address given in the FixedIPs parameter. For
example:
  RedisVirtualFixedIPs:
    - ip_address: 1.0.0.5
      use_neutron: false

Alternatively the fixed-ips can be set using the
'ServiceVips' parameter, like this:

 ServiceVips:
   redis: 1.0.0.5
   ovs_dbs: 1.0.0.6

NOTE: If the neutron service is not available the
      tripleo_service_vip ansible module will "echo"
      the IP provided in %service%VirtualFixedIPs.

Related: blueprint network-data-v2-ports
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/777307
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/779883
Change-Id: I4794418546363888e7a555a16b45b7a4417f1ef8

commit_message:
Do not use pregenerated tokens with a pre-built ISO

If an ISO is provided by a user and removable configuration is not used,
we cannot embed the token. Retrieve it normally instead.

Change-Id: Ie5f735e077f4cee89d7ae59c414909eb4e0c734b

subject: WIP: Account and Container Audit Watchers
messages:
[{'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2021-04-08 10:01:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2021-04-08 10:02:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2021-04-08 10:03:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2021-04-09 00:51:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2021-04-09 00:56:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

SLOs for sharded conatiners in the container walker bucket inventory now mostly work (once you add SLO to the interenal client), however SLO's will update their manifest with etag and bytes which may change behind the scenes meaning you can't actaully get the SLO .inventory object.

If we decide to use an approach like this we need to have a way of having a manifest where we don't care about the etag or bytes of a segment. We could use DLO, but as things shard and change then the point of the SLO is that the object will only have what the sharded container things is appropriate. So kinda need a less strict manifest version."}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2021-04-09 02:02:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2021-04-12 00:22:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2021-04-12 00:35:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Commit message was updated.'}]

[{'created': '2021-04-08 10:01:56.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Container Audit Watchers

Now that we have object audit watchers, let's have the ability to create
database audit watcher. That is account and container watchers.

Instead of a see_object, db watchers have a see_broker(broker).

There is also a very experimental bucket inventory container watcher
that by defaults puts the inventory in an object called .inventory in
the said container. On sharded containers this will be an SLO (once I
get it working).

commit_message:
WIP: Account and Container Audit Watchers

Now that we have object audit watchers, let's have the ability to create
database audit watcher. That is account and container watchers.

Instead of a see_object, db watchers have a see_broker(broker).

There is also a very experimental bucket inventory container watcher
that by defaults puts the inventory in an object called .inventory in
the said container. On sharded containers this will be an SLO (once I
get it working). This inventory is just a json-ifyed version of the
object table.

Change-Id: I206eea1b0c36d941307f80447c4fd64fcf83b6f2

but the error handling code is not consistent with how it applies

maintain I've added comments and additional tests as well as tightening
up StopIteration exception handling.

commit_message:
Refactor EC multipart/byteranges control flow

The multipart document handling in the proxy is consumed via iteration,
but the error handling code is not consistent with how it applies
conversions of IO errors/timeouts and retry failures to StopIteration.

In an effort to make the code more obvious and easier to debug and
maintain I've added comments and additional tests as well as tightening
up StopIteration exception handling.

Co-Authored-By: Alistair Coles <alistairncoles@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I0654815543be3df059eb2875d9b3669dbd97f5b4

'}, {'created': '2021-04-08 22:45:29.000000000', 'message': "Stop overriding manila tempest params

Manila's CephFS driver that we're testing
in scenario004 started supporting
snapshots and snapshot cloning, and our
tempest opts are incompatible.

Since tempestconf has a way to detect
the right options, lets stop overriding
in the job definitions.

Periodic RDO jobs will need to be fixed
in the same manner.

Depends-On: Iecb1328f1fb3d54cfd91bb9c23d2d8ee40cf3b33
Related-Bug: #1922784
Change-Id: I4fbe340a110cb0b99e786844760af134672cda37

commit_message:
Stop overriding manila tempest params

Manila's CephFS driver that we're testing
in scenario004 started supporting
snapshots and snapshot cloning, and our
tempest opts are incompatible.

Since tempestconf has a way to detect
the right options, lets stop overriding
in the job definitions.

Periodic RDO jobs will need to be fixed
in the same manner.

Depends-On: https://review.rdoproject.org/r/c/rdoinfo/+/33233
Related-Bug: #1922784
Change-Id: I4fbe340a110cb0b99e786844760af134672cda37

commit_message:
Use centos8 stream images with molecule scenarios

There have been problems with centos7 lately with py2/py3.
Ansible's pip module used python2 instead of python3 for
creating virtual venv which lead to dependency issues with
infrared which should be installed only by py3.

This changes also bumps the linters, removing yamllint which is now
included in ansible-lint.

Change-Id: If117b438fd55b17ead4016aabc3feae6632e722b

commit_message:
Remove rhel7/centos7 image yaml

Support for centos7 was dropped in Ussuri, and downstream has been
rhel8 based since Train. This change removes the image yaml file for
these unsupported OS versions.

Change-Id: I546d76b813cd60d0e26c0183fb37b9672afc413e

commit_message:
HA: fix injection of certificate in haproxy container

Injection of certificate in pacemaker-managed haproxy [1] is never
exercised due to a bad parsing of container name vs container id.

Closes-Bug: #1922106

[1] Id7308f028f33716be5e3df6699c3f2c12e33e344

Change-Id: Ic6e4264c5ad46bd2589cc907c365af2d42fde63d

commit_message:
Mount /etc/openldap inside the keystone container

For configuring high availability for LDAP in keystone one
needs to edit /etc/openldap/ldap.conf. This worked
before control plane was containerised. Mounting the
openldap configuration into the keystone container
restores the previous behavior.

Change-Id: Id0d73a8ab0ddf7bf9e2b76ea14ffc9acff3a0ad3
Closes-Bug: #1923048
Resolves: rhbz#1944466
(cherry picked from commit 313e4484e2a219eec7affb5e1e5e61d41687c6fd)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-21 13:24:41.000000000', 'message': 'Install neutron components on Zun compute hosts without Nova

At present Zun will only work on hosts with Nova present as these
receive the relevant Neutron components. This patch adds the
Neutron components to the Zun compute group so they can be
installed in environments where Nova and Zun are kept separate.

Change-Id: I2dd9f8d066b25053d1a7acfe228ec72c58132c45
'}]
commit_message:
Install neutron components on Zun compute hosts without Nova

At present Zun will only work on hosts with Nova present as these
receive the relevant Neutron components. This patch adds the
Neutron components to the Zun compute group so they can be
installed in environments where Nova and Zun are kept separate.

Change-Id: I2dd9f8d066b25053d1a7acfe228ec72c58132c45

[{'created': '2021-04-09 19:08:08.000000000', 'message': 'Drop lower-constraints job

Running a lower-constraints job is optional in master, and seems
pointless in the stable branches, so drop it.

Additional information here:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-March/021204.html

Change-Id: Ic2f99a3a04cd4e42ffedff34e074e4c39fa6f144
'}]
commit_message:
Drop lower-constraints job

Running a lower-constraints job is optional in master, and seems
pointless in the stable branches, so drop it.

Additional information here:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-March/021204.html

Change-Id: Ic2f99a3a04cd4e42ffedff34e074e4c39fa6f144

commit_message:
Enable mypy on scheduler/report.py

There are already type hints in this file so now we enable checking
those hints. To make mypy happy some fields needed an explicit type
declaration.

Change-Id: Id1df976f067777d4115e3cb2c72d54764bb31c6a

commit_message:
Allow to override zun policy files

We implement `zun_policy_overrides` variable in order to allow
management of zun policy files when needed.

Change-Id: If58446a2ca1aa645e098df86c3d76c8ac94bf1a1

[{'created': '2021-02-01 09:37:36.000000000', 'message': 'Remove grenade jobs from old stable branches

As discussed and approved during the ironic wallaby midcycle, the grenade
jobs in old stable branches, starting from EM branches and up the oldest
not-EM (at this moment train) are removed.

Also multinode jobs are removed from EM branches.

And remove lower-constraints job.

Change-Id: I6728debb4e810f971eaa45f86565bbf822a335b2
'}, {'created': '2021-04-21 21:14:44.000000000', 'message': 'Remove grenade jobs from old stable branches

As discussed and approved during the ironic wallaby midcycle, the grenade
jobs in old stable branches, starting from EM branches and up the oldest
not-EM (at this moment train) are removed.

Also multinode jobs are removed from EM branches.

And remove lower-constraints job.

Pin tempest to version 23.0.0 in Python 2.7 job.

Change-Id: I6728debb4e810f971eaa45f86565bbf822a335b2
'}]
commit_message:
Remove grenade jobs from old stable branches

As discussed and approved during the ironic wallaby midcycle, the grenade
jobs in old stable branches, starting from EM branches and up the oldest
not-EM (at this moment train) are removed.

Also multinode jobs are removed from EM branches.

And remove lower-constraints job.

Pin tempest to version 23.0.0 in Python 2.7 job.

Change-Id: I6728debb4e810f971eaa45f86565bbf822a335b2

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-26 10:34:43.000000000', 'message': 'Force raising an timeout exception for rados connect

RadosClient::connect does not have an timeout option,
and pybind silently ignores user input which causes
rados.connect hangs indefinitely and does not yield
control. This patch uses a tpool and raises timeout
exception properly.

Change-Id: I2b1c7ee6e537cd71ad7ee5e6059792bfe06d7b1e

commit_message:
Force raising an timeout exception for rados connect

rados::connect silently ignores timeout input which causes
rados.connect hangs indefinitely and does not yield
control. This patch uses a tpool and raises timeout
exception properly.

Closes-Bug: #1925144
Change-Id: I2b1c7ee6e537cd71ad7ee5e6059792bfe06d7b1e

commit_message:
Pass existing DB obj to save DB requests

On port and network update ML2 plugin gets a db object
and can pass it to db_base_plugin_v2 when doing super call.

Change-Id: I1213f59fe643807f303e3ad7f24925fa333a5512
(cherry picked from commit 02f4eca1ae43b89775171f4f70be54075b95c9dd)

subject: Ensure that nagios user gets created with a password
messages:
[{'account_id': 20870, 'date': '2021-04-19 19:36:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 20870, 'date': '2021-04-20 06:39:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

Holding whilst testing nrpe change.'}, {'account_id': 20870, 'date': '2021-04-20 19:47:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 20870, 'date': '2021-04-20 20:59:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

charm-recheck-full'}, {'account_id': 20805, 'date': '2021-04-20 23:07:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I have been staring at this for over an hour and I still can't decide if this causes or relieves tech debt. I can't point to any one thing as overtly wrong, but as a whole it feels like rgildein introduced tech debt and we are doubling down on it here.

We should be using charm helpers for these tasks and not re-writing them in the charm. If we need to address LP Bug# 1905586 to do so, we should. If we have this problem with the nagios user all user/password updates using existing charm helpers have the same problem.

I won't die on this hill, so if expediency overrides me, I am OK with that. But this feels like the wrong solution."}, {'account_id': 20870, 'date': '2021-04-21 08:59:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1
> 
> I have been staring at this for over an hour and I still can't decide if this causes or relieves tech debt. I can't point to any one thing as overtly wrong, but as a whole it feels like rgildein introduced tech debt and we are doubling down on it here.

Yes, it was with a heavy heart that I finally submitted the patch; each fix to each problem just made the patch bigger.  I do feel that, at this stage in the release, that the fix should go into the charm only and not any of the dependent libraries, though.

> 
> We should be using charm helpers for these tasks and not re-writing them in the charm. If we need to address LP Bug# 1905586 to do so, we should. If we have this problem with the nagios user all user/password updates using existing charm helpers have the same problem.

I agree; but in the next cycle ... I think it is only problematic with nagios as it (seems to be?) the only one that tries to do this.  But we should fix it in the library (and if this merges) then fix it here properly.

> I won't die on this hill, so if expediency overrides me, I am OK with that. But this feels like the wrong solution.

I know; I tend to agree that it is the 'wrong' solution.  However, I feel it might be the most 'appropriate' for "right now"?'}, {'account_id': 20870, 'date': '2021-04-21 17:19:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 20805, 'date': '2021-04-21 17:20:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

Per discussion and tracking bug #1925377. We will land this fix as is.'}, {'account_id': 20805, 'date': '2021-04-21 18:26:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1

Landing.'}]

which was to ensure that the correct password update is used for
different versions of mysql (pre and post 5.7.5).  However, this change
has broken the nagios user creation due to not setting the password.

updating of the password is only done if the account already exists.

unfortuante error when the nagios change password was introduced.  The
charm detects if the 'nagios-password' key is used on charm-upgrade and
moves it to 'mysql-nagios.passwd'.  This enables the key to work with

and thus needs to be run for each unit when the nagios password is

happen.

commit_message:
Ensure that nagios user gets created with a password

The associated bug is due to a change introduced in commit d55dcde
which was to ensure that the correct password update is used for
different versions of mysql (pre and post 5.7.5).  However, this change
has broken the nagios user creation due to not setting the password.

This patch creates the nagios user and passord at the same time.  The
updating of the password is only done if the account already exists.

The change also corrects the nagios password store in leader-settings to
the 'mysql-nagios.passwd' key instead of 'nagios-password'.  This was an
unfortuante error when the nagios change password was introduced.  The
charm detects if the 'nagios-password' key is used on charm-upgrade and
moves it to 'mysql-nagios.passwd'.  This enables the key to work with
the standard MySQLHelper functions.

Finally, the ALTER command (on percona) doesn't update non-InnoDB tables
and thus needs to be run for each unit when the nagios password is
changed via the action.  The changes in percona_utils.py enable this to
happen.

Whilst the change looks large it ONLY affects the nagios password parts
of the charm.

The related bug is a tracking bug to serve as a reminder to fix this in
charm-helpers and this charm (i.e. make the charm-helpers code work to
change a password for any user other than root, and then enable this
charm to use that code).

Change-Id: Ibc751bef7b4654ebffdf843c556b193373e6e80c
Related-Bug: #1925377
Closes-Bug: #1925042

For configuring high availability for LDAP in keystone one
needs to edit /etc/openldap/ldap.conf. This worked
before control plane was containerised. Mounting the
openldap configuration into the keystone container
restores the previous behavior.

(cherry picked from commit 313e4484e2a219eec7affb5e1e5e61d41687c6fd)
'}]
commit_message:
Mount /etc/openldap inside the keystone container

For configuring high availability for LDAP in keystone one
needs to edit /etc/openldap/ldap.conf. This worked
before control plane was containerised. Mounting the
openldap configuration into the keystone container
restores the previous behavior.

Change-Id: Id0d73a8ab0ddf7bf9e2b76ea14ffc9acff3a0ad3
Closes-Bug: #1923048
Resolves: rhbz#1944466
(cherry picked from commit 313e4484e2a219eec7affb5e1e5e61d41687c6fd)

commit_message:
Add serialize_object() helper function

This function converts a SUDS object to a dictionary.

Originally implemented in Nova as "object_to_dict()", this function
moves to oslo.vmware to stop leaking the abstraction around the backing
SOAP library into depending projects. This is especially necessary since
we want to switch the backing SOAP library in [1].

[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/oslo-specs/specs/victoria/oslo-vmware-soap-library-switch.html

Change-Id: Ie1d42609104e604f9386c1b1a46be7dcd286e855

commit_message:
Add compute microversion 2.57

Compute 2.57 [1] removed the personality parameter and added the
user_data parameter to the server rebuild API. Also removed
maxPersonality and maxPersonalitySize from the limits API response.

https: //docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/reference/api-microversion-history.html#id53
Change-Id: Id098e7b9eddb2c94e93864211ab1bc6cfc068972

commit_message:
Move policy deprecation to base rules

All the policy rules are deprecated for base.RULE_ADMIN_API
so we can add this deprecation to base rule for system scope
which further can be used as new default for policies.

Change-Id: Idf028b44daab0469059d036c48d7c6ca36b01d96

commit_message:
keystone only puppet deployment

While evaluating new versions of a base
operating system it is handy to have a very
minimal deployment.

* configure_[images,networks] turned off
* tempest api tests only for keystone

Match TripleO's scenario000 deployment:
https://bit.ly/3tBNBor

Change-Id: Ie7ebee89b1ca00ca2fc50b7d1cbd2d8364daca46

'}]
commit_message:
Add a call to "udevadm settle" in write_image.sh

After GPT and MBR are destroyed systemd-udevd gets triggered
which may hold /dev/sda open preventing qemu-img from writting
its image.

Story: 2008830
Task: 42312
Change-Id: I6105192a16fcb7f6898910e8d0ab824d731d491d

commit_message:
Remove networking-midonet from our docs

It was deprecated in the Wallaby cycle due to lack of maintainers.
This patch removes networking-midonet as an stadium project from the
official Neutron docs.

Change-Id: I5cd3da80d78d98ec4b2a49574efc0ec075e75959

commit_message:
docs: Document location of nova.conf files

Turns out oslo.config actually supports executable-specific
configuration files as well as directories of configuration files. Who
knew?

Change-Id: Ifb71a45ed4df3c9cacd2193beed904f948f5cdc8
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-07 11:01:52.000000000', 'message': 'Add periodic jobs to test "nftables" binaries

In order to check how the "nftables" binaries work with Neutron, two
new jobs have been added to the periodic queue:
- neutron-tempest-plugin-scenario-linuxbridge-nftables
- neutron-tempest-plugin-scenario-openvswitch-iptables_hybrid-nftables

In those two jobs, the binaries for "iptables", "ip6tables",
"arptables" and "ebtables" are replaced with the "nftables"
counterparts; by default, newer operating systems use the "nftables"
versions, providing the legacy API to the user but executing the
new packet handling in Netfilter.

Change-Id: Idec6d480886298f6d71b1dd649c9255ee6b7bebb
Related-Bug: #1508155
Related-Bug: #1922892

commit_message:
Add periodic jobs to test "nftables" binaries

In order to check how the "nftables" binaries work with Neutron, two
new jobs have been added to the periodic queue:
- neutron-tempest-plugin-scenario-linuxbridge-nftables
- neutron-tempest-plugin-scenario-openvswitch-iptables_hybrid-nftables

In those two jobs, the binaries for "iptables", "ip6tables",
"arptables" and "ebtables" are replaced with the "nftables"
counterparts; by default, newer operating systems use the "nftables"
versions, providing the legacy API to the user but executing the
new packet handling in Netfilter.

Change-Id: Idec6d480886298f6d71b1dd649c9255ee6b7bebb
Related-Bug: #1508155
Related-Bug: #1922892

do, so perhaps we can deprecate this in the future. For now though,
simply document the thing. While we're here, we make some additional
related changes:

- Remove references to the 'policy.yaml' file for services that don't
  use policy (i.e. everything except the API services and, due to a bug,
  the nova-compute service).
- Update remaining references to the 'policy.yaml' file to include the
  'policy.d/' directory
- Update the help text for the '--api-name' and '--target' options of
  the 'nova-policy policy check' command to correct tense and better
  explain their purpose.

Also, yes, 'nova-policy policy check' is dumb. Don't blame me :)

commit_message:
docs: Add man pages for 'nova-policy'

I don't actually grok what this does that 'oslopolicy-checker' couldn't
do, so perhaps we can deprecate this in the future. For now though,
simply document the thing. While we're here, we make some additional
related changes:

- Remove references to the 'policy.yaml' file for services that don't
  use policy (i.e. everything except the API services and, due to a bug,
  the nova-compute service).
- Update remaining references to the 'policy.yaml' file to include the
  'policy.d/' directory
- Update the help text for the '--api-name' and '--target' options of
  the 'nova-policy policy check' command to correct tense and better
  explain their purpose.

Also, yes, 'nova-policy policy check' is dumb. Don't blame me :)

Change-Id: I913b0de9ec40a615da7bf9981852edef4a88fecb
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Related-bug: #1675486

commit_message:
Add tags option to the image upload

Despite having tags support while create_image and even testing this
part in [1], appropriate params were not created for method and thus
were not documented/available for usage.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk/src/branch/master/openstack/tests/unit/cloud/test_image.py#L358

Change-Id: Ia27bf629f3c422e036031f78679a1bdd8962eb2b

commit_message:
Add the DHCPReponder for IPv4

This patch implements the responder for DHCPv4. The main
work of the responder is to assemble the DHCP packet with
its protocol required options based on the information of
neutron Port/Subnet/Network.

Partially-Implements: bp/distributed-dhcp-for-ml2-ovs
Related-Bug: #1900934

Change-Id: I8b0466263388085bb1949ea37f4788579c46093a

commit_message:
Syncing neutron db with ovn does not provide external_ids for static routes

This change adds external_ids to the static routes in case the route is of
type gateway_ip during ovn_db_sync.

Change-Id: I17795b9986aa8655f5467dca0fb4e3cd5cb82252
Closes-Bug: #1902888

commit_message:
Improve cinder_type properties regex

This changes the regex for properties managed with
the cinder_type resource so that it supports the
format Cinder needs for multiattach and similar.

  multiattach=<is> True

This patch is needed so that cinder_type resources
can set the above.

See regex testing here [1]. Needs to be backported
to older versions so that cinder_type can be
properly used there as well.

[1] https://regexr.com/5imqk

Change-Id: If08fce9443281e65636aaaa99e3139732435f6f7

commit_message:
Add CinderBackupWorkers and CinderBackupMaxOperations

New CinderBackupWorkers and CinderBackupMaxOperations support
configuring the concurrency of cinder backup and restore operations.
The default values match cinder's own default values.

Change-Id: I9b6387a00bb5f422a68e7a84a4da2be5907d30c1

messages: [{'account_id': 27419, 'date': '2021-04-21 03:12:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 17216, 'date': '2021-04-21 06:18:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 17216, 'date': '2021-04-21 06:36:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-04-21 11:57:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-04-21 13:39:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-21 03:12:05.000000000', 'message': "Introducing default_tls_verify

TLS client verification used to be accidentally disabled in libvirt.
This was fixed in libvirt-6.10.0-1.
Which means, once you're using libvirt-6.10.0-1 or higher, a client
certificate is mandatory during live migration with TLS.

If we simply create the client certificate, this will fix live-migration
of newly created instance but will not fix already created instances.

This change will allow us to keep client certificate validation disabled
during the train release cycle and re-enable it from Wallaby and onward.

Related-Change: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/785438/
Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1945760
Change-Id: I628e5ef0a50799e44145fe4ed78303d0fdbf5838
(cherry picked from commit e28a1b8b70b97820fa99d0a33f594801d42211a2)
"}]
commit_message:
Introducing default_tls_verify

TLS client verification used to be accidentally disabled in libvirt.
This was fixed in libvirt-6.10.0-1.
Which means, once you're using libvirt-6.10.0-1 or higher, a client
certificate is mandatory during live migration with TLS.

If we simply create the client certificate, this will fix live-migration
of newly created instance but will not fix already created instances.

This change will allow us to keep client certificate validation disabled
during the train release cycle and re-enable it from Wallaby and onward.

Related-Change: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/785438/
Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1945760
Change-Id: I628e5ef0a50799e44145fe4ed78303d0fdbf5838
(cherry picked from commit e28a1b8b70b97820fa99d0a33f594801d42211a2)

commit_message:
Use TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is old name and deprecated
This allows to use upper-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

Change-Id: I842b17f6bf705071d93902ca40250bc79ae66d6d

commit_message:
ovn: Add neutron-cleanup

The service cleans up orphaned tap devices on node boot. This is good
for cases were node was fenced or hard rebooted. There is similar patch
for OVS deployments [1].

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/81265737187f32eef2b654a901ed74818873eb88

Closes-bug: #1899799

Change-Id: Idec9e5ca0a8d3de7414938c7f280c06bcbd906c1
Signed-off-by: Jakub Libosvar <libosvar@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 92b6f306246468ecd26bdb5339b75bc574a9e9a3)
