commit_message:
Update hacking dependency to fix CI jobs

The project's PEP8 job fails with the following error:

  The conflict is caused by:
      The user requested flake8 3.8.3
      hacking 3.0.1 depends on flake8<3.8.0 and >=3.6.0

The project's lower-constratins job fails with the following error:

  ERROR: Could not find a version that satisfies the requirement
         bandit<1.7.0,>=1.6.0
  ERROR: No matching distribution found for bandit<1.7.0,>=1.6.0

This patch fixes both jobs by updating the hacking dependency to a
compatible version.

Change-Id: Iecfd9ab628229a20307a2dd3b2a16ffb56ff65f3

commit_message:
fix: the creds params doesn't check dict type

In the Enforcer.enforce or Enforcer.authorize function, when using
a dictionary in the case of the creds parameter, will get
an InvalidContextObject Exception.
The message prompts that you should use "RequestContext", "dict" or
the output of "RequestContext.to_policy_values", dict type should pass,
but it's not.

Change-Id: I1627d70d7fd661c6dd0faee7e1b648724c8c0814

commit_message:
Add ability to show full object table and referrers + referents

It can be quite useful to see the full object table and how many
objects are being referred to diagnois GC issues so include that
information (which takes a long time to gather) via a new option
'gc_detailed' (which is by default off).

Change-Id: I2f187214f2e1a8f81a12a7705fe396f8cf07fd73

commit_message:
Change default behavior for YAML

The default value for the policy_file option was policy.json.
Since the policy file is now YAML, we should also support a
filename of policy.yaml by default.

bp policy-yaml

Change-Id: Ia0adc3a5c76e9db6a1fb5dc92d5b55f8ac880d63

commit_message:
Bump the openstackdocstheme extension to 1.20

Some options are now automatically configured by the version 1.20:
- project
- html_last_updated_fmt
- latex_engine
- latex_elements
- version
- release.

commit_message:
Disabling LM PostCopy and AutoConverge for RT roles

It's not recommended to have NovaLiveMigrationPermitPostCopy and
NovaLiveMigrationPermitAutoConverge enabled for realtime roles.

Change-Id: I11584e5cf12bf654dd4e909dc50555003c576d1a
(cherry picked from commit 0d4a5f04f945bd6debec46c58e4e86161f195829)

commit_message:
Let the flag --no-stream to work

Currently it didnt matter whether you execute the tripleo-repo with --stream or
with the --no-stream flag as it always tries to execute with the --stream flag.

This patch checks whether the flag --no-stream was added and set stream to false

Change-Id: I584da16960c3795061464fa1344a6ded744a72b1
Closes-bug: 1925224

commit_message:
Include proper log when Kuryr cannot reach Octavia API

This is not the proper way of informing user that Octavia returns 503,
we should have a nice message or we'll start getting bug reports on us

Closes-bug: 1918708

Change-Id: I871c3998edb5b1d594067b60e908c453ad122dde

commit_message:
[Update] ES helm-test script updated

This ps removes the test_api_object_creation function as the api_objects map is now more
dynamic with ability to create, delete etc.
This function throws error when it does a GET on the objects that first
needs to be created(PUT).
This function is no longer relevant with the updated create-templates
job which is more robust.

Change-Id: I9f37c86ae9ca4bf32c417880926b6a3c3e78cb8a

commit_message:
Add a call to "udevadm settle" in write_image.sh

After GPT and MBR are destroyed systemd-udevd gets triggered
which may hold /dev/sda open preventing qemu-img from writting
its image.

Story: 2008830
Task: 42312
Change-Id: I6105192a16fcb7f6898910e8d0ab824d731d491d

commit_message:
Compute VIPs using net_vip_map instead of hiera

This change provides two improvements:
1. VIPs are computed using the existing net_vip_map instead of running
   hiera commands;
2. the monitoring_stack_vip (on the storage network) is provided for
   both prometheus and alertmanager: these two services are not exposed
   but we need the ceph_mgr being aware about the vip.

Depends-On: I0dbcde302a3abdfccc3dd996b1c238e25064dd12

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/puppet-tripleo/+/785574/

Change-Id: I73a2a54afdf9739bd4c08406645809c9b47c3e01

CentOS used to have spice-html5 package in epel, but it's not the case
for CentOS 8 or Stream. Thus, we need to install SPICE from git repo
even for distro installs.

Change-Id: If435ba24dbdf12450cead70e0e1eaecc50f46470
Closes-Bug: #1923183

"}]
commit_message:
Install spice-html5 from source for RedHat

CentOS used to have spice-html5 package in epel, but it's not the case
for CentOS 8 or Stream. Thus, we need to install SPICE from git repo
even for distro installs.

Change-Id: If435ba24dbdf12450cead70e0e1eaecc50f46470
Closes-Bug: #1923183
(cherry picked from commit 101f5d5b1790eebd8caae6acab2ecf6671ac046f)

commit_message:
Optimize cluster list api (continued)

Up till now, cluster api controller cluster_template_id was a
property field loading the id from the DB every time. With this
change the field becomes of text type and mandatory, so wsme fwk
guarantees that the field is provided when needed.

Cluster objects will not load the cluster template on creation.
Instead cluster templates will be loaded when they are actually
needed.

story: 2006693
task: 36989

Change-Id: I5aced1cebbe95492a7a35354e59424e51ba63b63

commit_message:
Use a more targeted job for tripleo-validations

* using multinode jobs for validations is too heavy
and uses too much resources
* remove standalone004 - worthless sans rpm build
* add a validations job that targets validations

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/python-tripleoclient/+/786424
Change-Id: Ifef837dc884c7338f9396214e36a197cdbb060c6
(cherry picked from commit aa8d53b1d514bb6b90d67b288055d7df73a8d0a2)

subject: Apply Zun configuration for Docker based on inventory
messages:
[{'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-02-03 09:18:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-02-03 09:48:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

Generally agree with the approach but:

1) should mention the now-known limitation in the docs
2) any idea why it did not affect our k-a CI scenario? It sounds like it's the perfect candidate to actually fail.
3) in the reno, should mention that current users might be affected and need to take manual action to fix their deployments"}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-02-03 09:54:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> (1 comment)
> 
> Generally agree with the approach but:
> 
> 1) should mention the now-known limitation in the docs

What do you mean by the limitation?

> 2) any idea why it did not affect our k-a CI scenario? It sounds like it's the perfect candidate to actually fail.

We have all groups present in the inventory, and we only set docker_configure_for_zun in the zun scenario.

> 3) in the reno, should mention that current users might be affected and need to take manual action to fix their deployments

Or run bootstrap-servers again?"}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-02-03 09:57:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> (1 comment)
> 
> > Patch Set 1:
> > 
> > (1 comment)
> > 
> > Generally agree with the approach but:
> > 
> > 1) should mention the now-known limitation in the docs
> 
> What do you mean by the limitation?

I understood the bug report as follows: the control nodes cannot run zun-compute config tasks.
So this is a new limitation.

> > 2) any idea why it did not affect our k-a CI scenario? It sounds like it's the perfect candidate to actually fail.
> 
> We have all groups present in the inventory, and we only set docker_configure_for_zun in the zun scenario.

Following up on 1: then the zun scenario should be failing, should not it? Because it colocates all the services.
 
> > 3) in the reno, should mention that current users might be affected and need to take manual action to fix their deployments
> 
> Or run bootstrap-servers again?

Yeah, which we recommend against. ;-)

Let me know if I misunderstood the bug. Perhaps I did."}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-02-03 10:28:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> > Patch Set 1:
> > 
> > (1 comment)
> > 
> > > Patch Set 1:
> > > 
> > > (1 comment)
> > > 
> > > Generally agree with the approach but:
> > > 
> > > 1) should mention the now-known limitation in the docs
> > 
> > What do you mean by the limitation?
> 
> I understood the bug report as follows: the control nodes cannot run zun-compute config tasks.
> So this is a new limitation.
> 
> > > 2) any idea why it did not affect our k-a CI scenario? It sounds like it's the perfect candidate to actually fail.
> > 
> > We have all groups present in the inventory, and we only set docker_configure_for_zun in the zun scenario.
> 
> Following up on 1: then the zun scenario should be failing, should not it? Because it colocates all the services.
>  
> > > 3) in the reno, should mention that current users might be affected and need to take manual action to fix their deployments
> > 
> > Or run bootstrap-servers again?
> 
> Yeah, which we recommend against. ;-)
> 
> Let me know if I misunderstood the bug. Perhaps I did.

The specific case that was hit in kayobe is where we reuse globals.yml between the seed (bifrost) and cloud, but have separate inventories. If you enable zun docker config, it ends up in globals.yml used by the seed. The specific failure is that the cluster-store config option is used on the seed, but contains no etcd hosts, causing docker to fail to start.

More generally, we should only apply docker config for zun where it is required, i.e. on zun-compute and zun-cni-daemon hosts."}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-02-03 12:34:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Tested that this fixes the kayobe issue in https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kayobe/+/773857'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-02-03 15:50:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

I am sold then'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-04-21 09:18:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-04-21 10:42:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Published edit on patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-04-21 11:37:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Review-Priority+1

bugfix to release'}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2021-04-21 11:39:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Apply Zun configuration for Docker based on inventory

If docker_configure_for_zun is set to true, then Zun-specific
configuration for Docker is applied to all nodes. It should only be
applied based on the relevant inventory groups. In some cases this can
cause Docker to fail to start. See
https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2008544 for details.

This change applies the configuration based on the zun-compute and
zun-cni-daemon groups. It also modifies the expression to not assume
that these groups exist in the inventory.

Change-Id: I0141abf0dd83e3a567ea6dcca945f86db129becf
Closes-Bug: #1914378
Story: 2008544
Task: 41645
Co-Authored-By: Buddhika Sanjeewa <bsanjeewa@kln.ac.lk>

commit_message:
Enable mypy on libvirt/guest.py

This patch fixes couple of thing that is needed to run mypy

* fixed a wrong type hint in LibvirtDriver._add_vtpm_device,
  _configure_guest_by_virt_type, and _conf_non_lxc signature
* fixed a local variable type hint in LibvirtDriver._create_guest_with_network
* added an assert to _create_guest_with_network as the guest local
  variable can be None if we get eventlet.timeout.Timeout and
  CONF.vif_plugging_is_fatal is False.

Change-Id: I42c579531bac61063a381598094720271364ec92

commit_message:
Move the guest.get_disk test to test_guest

As a follow up of I86153d31b02e6b74b42d53a6800297cbd0e5cbb4 the two
get_disk test that was mistakenly added to test_driver is now moved to
test_guest where they belong.

Change-Id: I17bd591ffb96b9b296bea04c87e286a83d40570e
Related-Bug: #1882521

commit_message:
Remove legacy tripleo-validations configurations

This patch removes:
* legacy tripleo-validations config boolean, since now the role
  is in tripleo-validations repos and is enabling by another
  configuration in the zuul config directly
* documentation, because its now outdated and a new one should
  be moved under tripleo-validations repos

Change-Id: Ibc5e1aec08643d53760953ebb1c026e99689a2b6

Essentially yes. Although it's not my fault. Well it is my fault. But not my *fault*. See, the way we tested this validation relied on a package being out of date. And possibly on a bug in the validation behavior I fixed. 

One way or another the molecule test is broken and strider has spend some time trying to implement a mock package and mock package repo to get around it. I'm not sure what his status is right now, but I think it might be a good idea to discuss this at the meeting. thx David."}, {'account_id': 11491, 'date': '2021-04-01 05:22:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 24.'}, {'account_id': 11491, 'date': '2021-04-01 05:31:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 24:

Sorry, I've just only worked on it yesterday night! Didn't have time before!

But here is a better molecule test scenario with dummy packages and repo. 

However, the custom lib should be debugged because it fails like this:

Did you mean to check in these RPMs?'}, {'account_id': 32926, 'date': '2021-04-01 14:43:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 36:

> Patch Set 36:
> 
> Did you mean to check in these RPMs?

Actually yes! Molecule needs them to test this validation. 
It was Gaels idea, believe it or not this is the easiest way to do it.

All the RPMs are just dummies, their versions are what is important.
Because this validation relies on package manager to do the heavy lifting.'}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2021-04-06 07:47:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 36: Code-Review-1

(6 comments)'}, {'account_id': 32926, 'date': '2021-04-06 09:02:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 36:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 32926, 'date': '2021-04-06 09:06:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 37.'}, {'account_id': 32926, 'date': '2021-04-06 09:36:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 38.'}, {'account_id': 11491, 'date': '2021-04-06 09:51:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 39.'}, {'account_id': 32926, 'date': '2021-04-06 11:02:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 40.'}, {'account_id': 32926, 'date': '2021-04-06 11:47:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 41.'}, {'account_id': 32926, 'date': '2021-04-07 06:49:17.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer Jiri Podivin.'}, {'account_id': 32926, 'date': '2021-04-13 08:51:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 42.'}, {'account_id': 32926, 'date': '2021-04-13 09:58:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 43.'}, {'account_id': 27427, 'date': '2021-04-13 12:55:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 43: Code-Review-1

(6 comments)

Nice work.  I'd like to highlight some concerns I've commented in specific places, but essentially I'd say that you're forgetting other people are not in your brain. :-)

What I mean by that is that you're making some necessary kludges you're not mega proud of, but instead of articulating those kludges and explaining your rationale, you are instead just stating that the code isn't great.  This is a bad thing to do for two reasons.  1) It's self-deprecating which is never a good idea for your mental health, and 2) it reads as scary to other engineers who don't know _why_ _you_ think this is bad.  It makes assumptions.

Please elaborate on these concerns in the code / comments.  Everything is an engineering trade off, and we need to articulate those trade offs when they're not self-evident. :-)

Keep up the great work Jiri!"}, {'account_id': 32926, 'date': '2021-04-13 14:53:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 44.'}, {'account_id': 32926, 'date': '2021-04-13 15:00:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 44:

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 11491, 'date': '2021-04-14 05:35:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 44: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 32926, 'date': '2021-04-15 08:16:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 44: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 32926, 'date': '2021-04-15 08:29:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 45.'}, {'account_id': 27427, 'date': '2021-04-15 15:20:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 45: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 16515, 'date': '2021-04-21 08:34:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 45: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

'}, {'created': '2021-03-24 16:22:40.000000000', 'message': 'Make check_latest_packages_version roles more generic

This patch removes reference to TripleO and add logic to return a
warning if no packages are given in parameter.

It also brings a better testing coverage through Molecule.

This patch also refactors the module itself, so it now process
the packages in one go, and reports results to ansible.

Change-Id: I5427523f6397f30538cdebabdfc22bc547c2580e
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>

'}, {'created': '2021-03-30 15:00:43.000000000', 'message': "Make check_latest_packages_version roles more generic

This patch removes reference to TripleO and add logic to return a
warning if no packages are given in parameter.

It also brings a better testing coverage through Molecule.

This patch also refactors the module itself, so it now process
the packages in one go, and reports results to ansible.

Futhermore, validation will now check for appropriate package
arhchitecture, instead of assuming they are all the same.

Validation now also determines the package manager itself,
assuming it isn't provided one by ansible. Default fact gathering
is thus no longer needed, potentially saving storage and improving
performance.

Change-Id: I5427523f6397f30538cdebabdfc22bc547c2580e
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>
Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>

Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>
Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Make check_latest_packages_version roles more generic

This patch removes reference to TripleO packages.

It also brings a better testing coverage through Molecule.

This patch also refactors the module itself, so it now process
the packages in one go, and reports results to ansible.

Futhermore, validation will now check for appropriate package
arhchitecture, instead of assuming they are all the same.

Validation now also determines the package manager itself,
assuming it isn't provided one by ansible.
Default fact gathering is thus no longer needed,
potentially saving storage and improving performance.

Change-Id: I5427523f6397f30538cdebabdfc22bc547c2580e
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>
Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
[reno] Stop publishing release notes

Since we copy all release notes to the integrated repo there is not need
in publishing release notes for each repository. We should only verify their
validity and linting.


Change-Id: I45c240eb7ebb3df368780f2542d859b9413eeb5c

commit_message:
[goal] Deprecate the JSON formatted policy file

As per the community goal of migrating the policy file
the format from JSON to YAML[1], we need to replace policy.json to
policy.yaml and remove deprecated policy.json.

config_template has been choosen instead of the copy, since it can
properly handle content that has been lookuped.

We make a separate task not to restart service when it's not needed.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/wallaby/migrate-policy-format-from-json-to-yaml.html

Change-Id: Ie246d803b5c4e490af76351a595aedcf2fcff62b

commit_message:
CentOS Stream: update kolla-ansible Zuul jobs

The kolla-ansible jobs were renamed from centos8 to centos8s when they
switched to CentOS stream. The Kolla pipeline must reference the new
names, otherwise the jobs will not run.

Change-Id: Ic976765ef4aec30d8153a20aba5ab389265554bb

commit_message:
Bump MariaDB version to 10.5.9

We also workaround known mariadb bug which make upgrades from previous
version to fail because of changing privileges bits which ends up
in revoking some of the privileges from superusers.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/775684
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/781305
Change-Id: Id28057c9b9043c9ef609f4ed6f40a8a21a2e6a8e

Hi Liu, can you provide more info in the bug description? Apart from the trace log.

Can you provide a way to reproduce it?

This DB error should be re-triable and should not affect to the normal server operation.'}, {'account_id': 9531, 'date': '2021-02-25 12:38:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> Hi Liu, can you provide more info in the bug description? Apart from the trace log.
> 
> Can you provide a way to reproduce it?
> 
> This DB error should be re-triable and should not affect to the normal server operation.

@Rodolfo, nothing new, just delete an instance.

The error is encountered for the testing of https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1916761.
I noticed that one VM is turned to ERROR state after I was trying to delete.
Nova-compute shows error that some internal sever error on neutron-api call.

And then I found that error in neutron-server.'}, {'account_id': 11816, 'date': '2021-02-25 18:08:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

This flag should never be needed if you don't have "ON DELETE CASACDE" from foreign keys happening.   if you are getting an unexpected number of rows deleted, that points to a potential bug in the application that should be understood.'}, {'account_id': 11816, 'date': '2021-02-25 18:09:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

do you have a unit test that reproduces the condition here?   you definitely need a reproduction case and an understanding of why this happens.  if the issue was simply that some concurrent processes happened to delete the same row, then that would be that particular problem.'}, {'account_id': 9531, 'date': '2021-02-26 01:01:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9531, 'date': '2021-02-26 02:17:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> do you have a unit test that reproduces the condition here?   you definitely need a reproduction case and an understanding of why this happens.  if the issue was simply that some concurrent processes happened to delete the same row, then that would be that particular problem.

I'm adding the test case for the concurrently port delete:
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/777709/1/neutron/tests/unit/db/test_db_base_plugin_v2.py
For now I did not encounter the error of bug 1916889."}, {'account_id': 11816, 'date': '2021-02-26 14:54:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

the best best thing you could have here, is a unit test in neutron that fails when this flag isn't set.   then we'd know exactly what's going on.

OTOH if this was a one-off non-reproducible condition then it's not clear you want to start turning down assertions quite yet, unless this is a recurring issue (and if so, how can we reproduce it?)"}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2021-03-01 08:07:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2021-03-01 09:42:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Review-Priority+1'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2021-03-01 15:43:39.000000000', 'content': 'Removed Code-Review+2 by Slawek Kaplonski <skaplons@redhat.com>
'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2021-03-01 15:45:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1 -Review-Priority

Thinking more about it, let's hold on with this patch some more time and move on with it after we will do final release of the neutron-lib for Wallaby. Now we are very late in the cycle and I would like to avoid huge db changes which will potentially introduce serious bugs in Wallaby release. In new cycle we will have ca. 6 months to test this change 😊"}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2021-03-02 09:25:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1 -Review-Priority
> 
> Thinking more about it, let's hold on with this patch some more time and move on with it after we will do final release of the neutron-lib for Wallaby. Now we are very late in the cycle and I would like to avoid huge db changes which will potentially introduce serious bugs in Wallaby release. In new cycle we will have ca. 6 months to test this change 😊

Although with the new engine facade change this occurrence should be limited, we can have concurrency DB operations that could lead to this error. Some of those registers, like stdattr ones, that are always child rows, are more susceptible to raise this error.

Reviewing the documentation I'm fine adding this patch but as Slawek said, I would prefer to have a full cycle to test it. Let's merge it in Xena."}, {'account_id': 9531, 'date': '2021-04-21 01:15:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2021-04-21 07:21:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

I think we should push this patch now, during the initial steps of Xena cycle. In case of finding any kind of side effect, we'll have time to fix it."}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2021-04-21 09:04:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

> Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2
> 
> I think we should push this patch now, during the initial steps of Xena cycle. In case of finding any kind of side effect, we'll have time to fix it.

Ok, we are now on Xena. Let's merge it and see first in the periodic job which I proposed in https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/787329 to make sure it's running fine before we will release it."}]

commit_message:
Set confirm_deleted_rows=False to StandardAttribute obj

Do the work of the warning log suggests, since the how many
rows to delete of standardattributes is not an issue to Neutron.
The final goal is to delete them all.

Change-Id: I8113881a2bd2278ce8c912562a172f90e073b686
Closes-Bug: #1916889

[{'created': '2021-04-13 23:47:19.000000000', 'message': "Don't send empty remote_address_group_id for security groups

We are seeing an error raised by older Neutron's

 400: Client Error for url: <cloud>/v2.0/security-group-rules,
 Unrecognized attribute(s) 'remote_address_group_id'

This field was added unconditionally with
I50374c339ab7685a6e74f25f9521b8810c532e13 but, per above, appears to
cause problems for older Neutron instances.

To work around this, remove the argument from the body when blank by
overriding the _prepare_request function of SecurityGroupRule.

Two tests where this are used are updated; one checks the body is not
sent when None and the other is modified to send a
remote_address_group_id value to validate the other path.

Story: #2008577
Task: #41729
Change-Id: I25dabfde27b843df1c91c7fc37a1fe8d207b8010

commit_message:
Don't send empty remote_address_group_id for security groups

We are seeing an error raised by older Neutron's

 400: Client Error for url: <cloud>/v2.0/security-group-rules,
 Unrecognized attribute(s) 'remote_address_group_id'

This field was added unconditionally with
I50374c339ab7685a6e74f25f9521b8810c532e13 but, per above, appears to
cause problems for older Neutron instances.

To work around this, remove the argument from the body when blank by
overriding the _prepare_request function of SecurityGroupRule.

Two tests where this are used are updated; one checks the body is not
sent when None and the other is modified to send a
remote_address_group_id value to validate the other path.

Story: #2008577
Task: #41729
Change-Id: I25dabfde27b843df1c91c7fc37a1fe8d207b8010

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-12 19:02:41.000000000', 'message': "Introducing default_tls_verify

TLS client verification used to be accidentally disabled in libvirt.
This was fixed in libvirt-6.10.0-1.
Which means, once you're using libvirt-6.10.0-1 or higher, a client
certificate is mandatory during live migration with TLS.

If we simply create the client certificate, this will fix live-migration
of newly created instance but will not fix already created instances.

This change will allow us to keep client certificate validation disabled
during the train release cycle and re-enable it from Wallaby and onward.

Related-Change: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/785438/
Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1945760
Change-Id: I628e5ef0a50799e44145fe4ed78303d0fdbf5838
"}, {'created': '2021-04-12 19:44:21.000000000', 'message': "Introducing default_tls_verify

TLS client verification used to be accidentally disabled in libvirt.
This was fixed in libvirt-6.10.0-1.
Which means, once you're using libvirt-6.10.0-1 or higher, a client
certificate is mandatory during live migration with TLS.

If we simply create the client certificate, this will fix live-migration
of newly created instance but will not fix already created instances.

This change will allow us to keep client certificate validation disabled
during the train release cycle and re-enable it from Wallaby and onward.

commit_message:
Introducing default_tls_verify

TLS client verification used to be accidentally disabled in libvirt.
This was fixed in libvirt-6.10.0-1.
Which means, once you're using libvirt-6.10.0-1 or higher, a client
certificate is mandatory during live migration with TLS.

If we simply create the client certificate, this will fix live-migration
of newly created instance but will not fix already created instances.

This change will allow us to keep client certificate validation disabled
during the train release cycle and re-enable it from Wallaby and onward.

Related-Change: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/785438/
Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1945760
Change-Id: I628e5ef0a50799e44145fe4ed78303d0fdbf5838

Some higher versions of grub2 (e.g. 2.05 or 2.06-rc1) use
grub.cfg-01-MAC, while another lower versions of
grub2 (e.g. 2.04) use MAC.conf, so we generate both paths
in order to be compatible with both.

(cherry picked from commit 8f474bfe598849d0dfffb4ede11057f0411dde3c)

commit_message:
update grub2 file name

Some higher versions of grub2 (e.g. 2.05 or 2.06-rc1) use
grub.cfg-01-MAC, while another lower versions of
grub2 (e.g. 2.04) use MAC.conf, so we generate both paths
in order to be compatible with both.

For more information we can see:
https://docs.oracle.com/en/operating-systems/oracle-linux/7/install/ol7-install-prepare.html#ol7-install-pxe-boot-uefi

Change-Id: Icbdd284de38b8e54c52cdbba709bba0e644c35cd
Signed-off-by: Armstrong Liu <vpbvmw651078@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 8f474bfe598849d0dfffb4ede11057f0411dde3c)

commit_message:
Quarantine solitary EC fragments - Followup

Just a patch to squash in. It fixes a bunch of tests (but not all I ran
out of time), adds another lonely frag test which tests 2 - 9 lonely
frags. Plus makes the new reconstructor code py3 compliant.

Change-Id: I07277e82646b650e5ed81b4b703498dc7fe49d0a

Moving on py3 as the default runtime for tox to avoid to update this at

commit_message:
Use py3 as the default runtime for tox

Moving on py3 as the default runtime for tox to avoid to update this at
each new cycle.

Wallaby support officially the following runtimes [1]:
- Python 3.6
- Python 3.8

During Victoria Python 3.7 was used as the default runtime [2] however this
version isn't longer officially supported.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/wallaby.html#python-runtimes-for-wallaby
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/victoria.html#python-runtimes-for-victoria

Change-Id: I4b150e3d4156bbfa272afa7affe8ca967ecdeea0

commit_message:
Use py3 as the default runtime for tox

Moving on py3 as the default runtime for tox to avoid to update this at
each new cycle.

Wallaby support officially the following runtimes [1]:
- Python 3.6
- Python 3.8

During Victoria Python 3.7 was used as the default runtime [2] however this
version isn't longer officially supported.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/wallaby.html#python-runtimes-for-wallaby
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/victoria.html#python-runtimes-for-victoria

Change-Id: I832d5805a138d7d091dffa100110c90cb80c23b4

[{'created': '2021-03-26 11:30:26.000000000', 'message': '[neutron] Get only ID and name of the SGs from Neutron

During the VM booting process Nova asks Neutron for the security groups
of the project. If there are no any fields specified, Neutron will
prepare list of security groups with all fields, including rules.
In case if project got many SGs, it may take long time as rules needs to
be loaded separately for each SG on Neutron's side.

During booting of the VM, Nova really needs only "id" and "name" of the
security groups so this patch limits request to only those 2 fields.

This lazy loading of the SG rules was introduced in Neutron in [1] and
[2].

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/630401/
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/637407/

Related-Bug: #1865223
Change-Id: I15c3119857970c38541f4de270bd561166334548
'}]
commit_message:
[neutron] Get only ID and name of the SGs from Neutron

During the VM booting process Nova asks Neutron for the security groups
of the project. If there are no any fields specified, Neutron will
prepare list of security groups with all fields, including rules.
In case if project got many SGs, it may take long time as rules needs to
be loaded separately for each SG on Neutron's side.

During booting of the VM, Nova really needs only "id" and "name" of the
security groups so this patch limits request to only those 2 fields.

This lazy loading of the SG rules was introduced in Neutron in [1] and
[2].

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/630401/
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/637407/

Related-Bug: #1865223
Change-Id: I15c3119857970c38541f4de270bd561166334548

commit_message:
Setting DEFAULT to False.

In openstack when user logged in, user is redirected to project page
but after installation of mistral , now default dashboard page is
set to mistral.
In order to make project as default dashboard page setting
DEFAULT as False.

Change-Id: I663149cc4986f5c1ca83a819eb10bf484baa228a
(cherry picked from commit 7fd7c820d106cdaacb3e13c80bc8628744c4f80c)

commit_message:
Setting DEFAULT to False.

In openstack when user logged in, user is redirected to project page
but after installation of mistral , now default dashboard page is
set to mistral.
In order to make project as default dashboard page setting
DEFAULT as False.

Change-Id: I663149cc4986f5c1ca83a819eb10bf484baa228a
(cherry picked from commit 7fd7c820d106cdaacb3e13c80bc8628744c4f80c)

commit_message:
Aliases for a few unfortunately named state transitions

This RFE proposes a new microversion that will provide
aliases to two poorly named provisioning verbs
to match the existing CLI commands

Story: #2007551
Task: #39402
Change-Id: Ifd14aebbfb4b17c5108f44092dac0b89d1c2c50a

commit_message:
Fix gate jobs

This patch update the following:
* add ignore_basepython_conflict = true in tox.ini file.
* replace horizon tarballs dependency with constraints file.
* update hacking version to latest 4.0.0 version.
* fix pep8 warnings.

Change-Id: If0275b78f9084e314e6a69e267a79fc4472c0dfe
(cherry picked from commit f5473fc2367a0ca40b33796e74d2ecdd106b36cd)
(cherry picked from commit cc68bea1c648e70d98bb53218ad653a1dbdc134c)

Change-Id: I0ff28d6895f46faab041734c2d0ff838daf16aaa

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-16 14:57:23.000000000', 'message': 'pylint: Fix migration E1120 no-value-for-parameter

Pylint raises E1120 on all many of our migrations because the insert
call is missing the dml parameter:

  cinder/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/123_cinder_init.py:870:9:
  E1120: No value for argument 'dml' in method call
  (no-value-for-parameter)

The dml parameter is automatically added by sqlalchemy using a
decorator, like this:

    @util.dependencies("sqlalchemy.sql.dml")
    def insert(self, dml, values=None, inline=False, **kwargs):

This patch adds the decorator to the pyling configured
signature-mutators to remove these errors from incorrectly showing.

Change-Id: Icbc72b3655f379c9b97134e68a425dc1d623dc7b
'}]
commit_message:
pylint: Fix migration E1120 no-value-for-parameter

Pylint raises E1120 on all many of our migrations because the insert
call is missing the dml parameter:

  cinder/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/123_cinder_init.py:870:9:
  E1120: No value for argument 'dml' in method call
  (no-value-for-parameter)

The dml parameter is automatically added by sqlalchemy using a
decorator, like this:

    @util.dependencies("sqlalchemy.sql.dml")
    def insert(self, dml, values=None, inline=False, **kwargs):

This patch adds the decorator to the pyling configured
signature-mutators to remove these errors from incorrectly showing.

Change-Id: Icbc72b3655f379c9b97134e68a425dc1d623dc7b

commit_message:
Use parameters of the nova::glance class

The glance_* parameters of the nova class have been deprecated in favor
of the new nova::glance class. This change replaced the deprecated
parameters with the new ones in that new class.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/770684
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/772525
Change-Id: If1f6273f921fb1df62ebdc5a4654d892d919a5be

commit_message:
Specify rbd_mirroring_mode none for erasure coded pools

Ceph does not support erasure coded pools for rbd-mirroring.
Unfortunately, ceph does not provide an easy way to determine if a
metadata pool is used for an erasure coded rbd pool. This adds
information to the CephBrokerRequest when creating a pool to explicitly
request an rbd_mirroring_mode of 'none' to indicate that rbd mirroring
should not be enabled.

Closes-Bug: #1898504
Change-Id: I32f8f96a6a5bdcf77ad52468d96b41b6139f3266

commit_message:
Host resource scale adjustment about ironic

Ironic does not need to reserve system resources, otherwise it will cause flavor to be unable to schedule.

Change-Id: I454d0468ae3424cc92d470c15a40ad96c01cf311

commit_message:
[OVN] Explicitly set nova-next job to ML2/OVS

This patch explicitly enable ML2/OVS for the nova-next job.

Devstack is changing the Neutron default to OVN backend. Currently, the
nova-next job requires QoS minimum bandwidth support in its
post_test_hook.sh script [0] which is currently not supported in OVN [1]
(feature needs to come to core OVN first).

[0]
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/ede0147abd54fdd043e7aabd33c01f88e4a01e51/gate/post_test_hook.sh#L131-L136
[1] https://docs.openstack.org/neutron/latest/ovn/gaps.html

Change-Id: I91b8056e73658fc815eb2f6711e89d4ab5deed92
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

commit_message:
keystone only puppet deployment

While evaluating new versions of a base
operating system it is handy to have a very
minimal deployment.

* tempest is turned off
* configure_[images,networks] turned off

Match TripleO's scenario000 deployment:
https://bit.ly/3tBNBor

Change-Id: I6a2ad58c402f557962569eaa8801ac0bcede87c6

[{'created': '2021-04-07 09:31:29.000000000', 'message': 'Base for improvement of validator test coverage

Moves test_tripleo_validator.py into v1 dir.
Constants used for tests moved to the fakes module.

Mock import guard added, in order to preferrentially import
new mock package instead of legacy.

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I799885c169acef9c6a772950e0fcaf09c5a97077

commit_message:
Base for improvement of validator test coverage

Moves test_tripleo_validator.py into v1 dir.
Constants used for tests moved to the fakes module.

Mock import guard added, in order to preferrentially import
new mock package instead of legacy.

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I799885c169acef9c6a772950e0fcaf09c5a97077

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-23 17:36:16.000000000', 'message': 'Create dedicated CLI for the Validation Framework

This review add a CLI for the Validation Framework which become
the only entry point to run the Validation Framework.

It will deprecates the tripleo_validatior.py CLI and the
validation.py script.

This patch use python cliff library to provide nice helpers, shell
and output formats.

Change-Id: I66800ad51cc50f4eb37efabe85fb553dce008101

commit_message:
Create dedicated CLI for the Validation Framework

This review adds a CLI for the Validation Framework which will become
the only entry point to run the Validation Framework.

It will deprecate the tripleo_validatior.py CLI and the
validation.py script.

This patch uses python cliff library to provide nice helpers, shell
and output formats.

Change-Id: I66800ad51cc50f4eb37efabe85fb553dce008101

commit_message:
Minor test improvement for ceph_pools_pg_protection

Tests now include check of run function and
required module attributes.

Closes-Bug: #1922726

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Id21cd63fff6e8cd2f0aad452ad8f1a5d8ce87930

'}, {'created': '2021-03-17 15:07:20.000000000', 'message': 'Test folder structure rearranged.

Patch prepares ground for further work on tripleo_validations
unit tests.

Unit test file test_triple_validator.py was moved to tests directory within
tripleo_validations tree, in order to facilitate test discovery
and to move towards traditional way tests are organized in python.

Datastructures used for testing were factored out.

__init__.py files for lookup plugins and library tests were added.
Together with minimal docstring.

.gitingore was updated to ignore stestr files.

test-requirements.txt were updated to include all necessary dependencies

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: If67992bec97831cc45b46e33af234a9444c5ae4c

commit_message:
Test folder structure rearranged.

Patch prepares ground for further work on tripleo_validations
unit tests.

Datastructures used for testing were factored out.

__init__.py files for lookup plugins and library tests were added.
Together with minimal docstring.

.gitingore was updated to ignore stestr files.

test-requirements.txt and requirements.txt were updated to include
all necessary dependencies

Depends-On: https://review.rdoproject.org/r/c/openstack/tripleo-validations-distgit/+/32545

Closes-Bug: #1922726

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: If67992bec97831cc45b46e33af234a9444c5ae4c

commit_message:
Add cinder RBD support for multiple ceph clusters

The CinderRbdMultiConfig parameter provides a mechanism for
configuring cinder RBD backends associated with external ceph
clusters defined by CephExternalMultiConfig.

A new nova_libvirt_init_secret.sh script handles the creation of
the libvirt secret that is required for nova to connect to volumes
on the cinder RBD backends.

Depends-On: I040e25341c9869ad289d7e7c98e831caef23fece
Change-Id: I73af5b868de629870a35d38f8436e7025aae791e

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-26 17:43:53.000000000', 'message': 'Add cinder RBD support for multiple ceph clusters

Following the pattern of other cinder backends, a new
tripleo::profile::base::cinder::volume::rbd::multi_config parameter
adds support for configuring cinder RBD backends associated with
multiple ceph clusters. The multi_config parameter is a hash that
specifies the settings required to access each additional cluster
(FSID, pool and client names, etc.).

This patch also deprecates legacy code that managed ACLs for the ceph
client keyring. THT already ensures cinder can access the keyring
using kolla_config permissions.

Change-Id: I040e25341c9869ad289d7e7c98e831caef23fece

commit_message:
Add cinder RBD support for multiple ceph clusters

Following the pattern of other cinder backends, a new
tripleo::profile::base::cinder::volume::rbd::multi_config parameter
adds support for configuring cinder RBD backends associated with
multiple ceph clusters. The multi_config parameter is a hash that
specifies the settings required to access each additional cluster
(FSID, pool and client names, etc.).

This patch also deprecates legacy code that managed ACLs for the ceph
client keyring. THT already ensures cinder can access the keyring
using kolla_config permissions.

Change-Id: I040e25341c9869ad289d7e7c98e831caef23fece

subject: Let the driver layer do works for every route event
messages:
[{'account_id': 9531, 'date': '2021-03-19 08:02:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 12021, 'date': '2021-03-19 09:26:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

I think that this change is wrong, because the BGP route processing logic here is not in fault and is actually correct. Changing it may introduce other side effects.

The issue lies in the dataplane and should be fixed there.

Besides, assuming we could replay route installation by tweaking the BGP route processing logic (again, as said above, I don't think we can), nothing guarantees that the routes would be re-emitted, so nothing ensures that states would be reinstalled."}, {'account_id': 12021, 'date': '2021-03-19 09:32:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

My recollection is that the part of the code that handles integration of BGPVPN with the l2 agent is under https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-bagpipe/src/branch/master/networking_bagpipe/agent/bgpvpn/agent_extension.py

You will find there the code that installs flows in tables 20 and 21 (UCAST_TO_TUN and FLOOD_TO_TUN).


The logic to handle OVS restarts is here: 

https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-bagpipe/src/branch/master/networking_bagpipe/agent/bgpvpn/agent_extension.py#L164-L166

https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-bagpipe/src/branch/master/networking_bagpipe/agent/bgpvpn/agent_extension.py#L610-L618

I think that you should investigate why these parts of the code do not trigger, or do not do their job as expected.'}, {'account_id': 9531, 'date': '2021-03-19 09:34:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2
> 
> I think that this change is wrong, because the BGP route processing logic here is not in fault and is actually correct. Changing it may introduce other side effects.
> 

My local test shows that this works fine. The flow can be installed again. I'm not an expert of this project, so your concerns make sense to me. But it's better to give us some detail about the side effects.

> The issue lies in the dataplane and should be fixed there.
> 

I have other solutions:
1. let the neutron does not clean the L2 and arp responder flows during the agent start (skip the stale flow clean procedure)
2. let the bagpipe_bgpvpn ovs-agent extension cache related routes(port info), and then receive the ``OVS_RESTARTED`` event to reinstall the flows.

> Besides, assuming we could replay route installation by tweaking the BGP route processing logic (again, as said above, I don't think we can), nothing guarantees that the routes would be re-emitted, so nothing ensures that states would be reinstalled.

Seems a dead end, no solution for such scenario?"}, {'account_id': 9531, 'date': '2021-03-19 09:42:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9531, 'date': '2021-03-19 09:57:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> My recollection is that the part of the code that handles integration of BGPVPN with the l2 agent is under https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-bagpipe/src/branch/master/networking_bagpipe/agent/bgpvpn/agent_extension.py
> 
> You will find there the code that installs flows in tables 20 and 21 (UCAST_TO_TUN and FLOOD_TO_TUN).
> 
> 
> The logic to handle OVS restarts is here: 
> 
> https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-bagpipe/src/branch/master/networking_bagpipe/agent/bgpvpn/agent_extension.py#L164-L166
> 
> https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-bagpipe/src/branch/master/networking_bagpipe/agent/bgpvpn/agent_extension.py#L610-L618
> 
> I think that you should investigate why these parts of the code do not trigger, or do not do their job as expected.

Yes, I noticed that part. But the bug is ovs-agent restart only. OpenvSwitch (vswitchd and ovsdb) are running just fine. So IMO, as I said in the last comment, the agent extension here should handle the agent restart event. Neutron has the ``AFTER_INIT`` event [1] now.
[1] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/agent/capabilities.py#L20'}, {'account_id': 9531, 'date': '2021-04-21 01:06:57.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

[{'created': '2021-03-19 08:02:45.000000000', 'message': 'Let the driver layer do works for every route event

The issue is when restart ovs agent only, the L2 and arp responder
flows will lose. The ovs-agent restart will process every port again,
so there will be new vif_plug and route event. So let the driver
layer to install the flow for route event no matter if it is
in cache.

Closes-Bug: #1919104
Change-Id: If4169a42544e024dd11c536bcc1a8e516e81c0e7

commit_message:
Let the driver layer do works for every route event

The issue is when restart ovs agent only, the L2 and arp responder
flows will lose. The ovs-agent restart will process every port again,
so there will be new vif_plug and route event. So let the driver
layer to install the flow for route event no matter if it is
in cache.

Closes-Bug: #1919104
Change-Id: If4169a42544e024dd11c536bcc1a8e516e81c0e7

 > 
 > IMO, but the change I propose if more complex, in case you have
 > concurrent processing (several agents like DHCP, L3, ip_conntrack,
 > etc), you should spawn a deamon per thread.
 > 
 > This solution removes a good implementation that can be use, with
 > some changes, for this multithreading operation.

DHCP and L3 now have a dynamic thread quantity change, it maybe not possible. And by the way, that neutron-state-change also will start a root wrapper deamon. IMO, such small process should not cost too much on such extra process.

And we do not remove it, just disable it by default, user can enable it anytime.'}, {'account_id': 9531, 'date': '2019-04-30 13:15:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

The idea of the rootwrap daemon was just the opposite, to speed up the privileged commands by having a daemon always running, instead of spawning new processed every time.

commit_message:
Speedup: do not use root_helper_daemon by default

When concurrently processing resources, a single root_helper_daemon
process leads to a linear time increase. This patch disabled it
by default.

Closes-Bug: #1825152
Change-Id: Id88169f5d00097463aa1488dd47f88713a5610d0

commit_message:
Limit netmiko not to use version 3.3.2

Neutron-server can not be booted successfully when using
netmiko 3.3.2. This patch limits netmiko using <3.3.2.

Change-Id: I55e705ff2266df59d2d89b27f696d85568c863a2
Closes-Bug: #1900447

commit_message:
Fix error when starting ssh for `nova-compute`

When starting sshd process, got error "Missing privilege separation
 directory: /run/sshd". This patch creates dir '/run/sshd' before
 staring `sshd`.

Story: #2008526
Task: #41607
Change-Id: Ic1252efde45cd4e22b0fb102e529f6314d38d33f

commit_message:
Fix error when resizing vm cause of account not avaiable

The user `nova` uses '/usr/sbin/nologin' shell. So the resizing of
 vm can not be successful cause of 'This account is currently not
 available.'. This patch modifies the shell of user `nova`.

Story: #2008535
Task: #41624
Change-Id: Id23dc1a49a561a1f093a0101007ad21150c0740a

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-15 05:18:35.000000000', 'message': 'nodepool: make ARM64 config names consistent

Our convention with the names is "<provider>-<region>" which hasn't
been followed for these two cases.

This mostly only affects the key for the stats reported to graphite.
I never noticed with linaro because our stats generally match
"<provider>-*" and "linaro-us" just so happened to match that :/

Change-Id: Icbbcebd48abc56d0458cb6f9fb1c0b63249f6da4
'}]
commit_message:
nodepool: make ARM64 config names consistent

Our convention with the names is "<provider>-<region>" which hasn't
been followed for these two cases.

This mostly only affects the key for the stats reported to graphite.
I never noticed with linaro because our stats generally match
"<provider>-*" and "linaro-us" just so happened to match that :/

Change-Id: Icbbcebd48abc56d0458cb6f9fb1c0b63249f6da4

commit_message:
Disable hirsute-wallaby test

hisute-wallaby test is disabled (moved to dev) due to [1] as bundle may
reference a reactive charm.

[1] https://github.com/juju-solutions/layer-basic/issues/194

commit_message:
Initialize privsep library in Neutron commands

Since the migration to privsep, some Neutron commands execute methods
under a privsep context. The privsep library must be initialized first.

Change-Id: Icd69bca23d781bace580b3937bc8bd25b586e852
Closes-Bug: #1923870

commit_message:
Use single NovaLibvirtNetwork to configure instance console components

Nova vnc configuration right now uses NovaVncProxyNetwork,
NovaLibvirtNetwork and NovaApiNetwork to configure the different
components (novnc proxy, nova-compute and libvirt) for vnc.
If one of the networks get changed from internal_api, the service
configuration between libvirt, nova-compute and novnc proxy gets
inconsistent and the console is broken.
This changed to just use NovaLibvirtNetwork for configuring the vnc
endpoints and removes NovaVncProxyNetwork completely.

Conflicts:
 deployment/nova/nova-vnc-proxy-container-puppet.yaml

Added missing change from https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/786082

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/puppet-tripleo/+/781611

Change-Id: Icef2481b65b41b524ad44eeecfbee4451006e1d2
Closes-Bug: #1917719
(cherry picked from commit dadf71fcae73825888b8ed4850de5a6ecf2fc29d)
(cherry picked from commit 05b191d3e6254fcd6ded4fd8161456f3d5d89632)

commit_message:
[OVN] Fix FDB table not registered in OvnSbIdl

With MAC learning a new table FDB has been added to OVN [0]. It needs to
be registered into OvnSbIdl so that it is recognized.

[0] https://github.com/ovn-org/ovn/commit/6ec3b12590f9193659d549e30d96b1a22bbb1288

Related-Bug: #1904412
Change-Id: I08ae3cfb52c74e013eb6ad57254bc065227d60a4
Signed-off-by: Elvira García <egarciar@redhat.com>
(manually cherry picked from commit 662cd600753476a4f64df64361a0d31ecf54a1ec)

commit_message:
Support passing client certificates for server version requests

Using the cinderclient to fetch server versions will fail with error
`OpenSSL.SSL.Error: [sslv3 alert handshake failure]` when the server
requires client certificates to be passed with these requests.

Added the optional parameter `cert` to both get_server_version
get_highest_client_server_version and methods so that users can have
the option to pass client certificates while fetching server versions.

Also support passing mTLS certificate/key to HTTPClient

Closes-Bug: #1915996
Change-Id: I57c665dd9d4b8c32e5f10994d891d1e0f5315548
Signed-off-by: sri harsha mekala <smekala@oath.com>

commit_message:
Limit access to sshd used for nova migration

Previously access to the sshd running by the nova-migration-target
container is only limited via the sshd_config. While login is
not possible from other networks, the service is reachable via
all networks. This change limits the access to the NovaLibvirt
and NovaApi networks which are used for cold and live-migration.

Change-Id: Ie868463143af66c7004dbcacefde76ca0977880e
(cherry picked from commit c04c9b0d701abb91ddacf0fd5320899d907e6cf1)

commit_message:
Disabling LM PostCopy and AutoConverge for RT roles

It's not recommended to have NovaLiveMigrationPermitPostCopy and
NovaLiveMigrationPermitAutoConverge enabled for realtime roles.

Change-Id: I11584e5cf12bf654dd4e909dc50555003c576d1a
(cherry picked from commit 0d4a5f04f945bd6debec46c58e4e86161f195829)
(cherry picked from commit b542452cc443ce4e7d766b84e624e0d6c929bf51)

[{'created': '2021-04-09 14:15:29.000000000', 'message': "Add locks for setting iptables rules in l3 and metadata agents

Router_info class and metadata agent's driver are using same
instance of the iptables manager class and it could happend that
sometimes e.g. nat rule which packets send to 169.254.169.254:80
redirects to the port 9697 so haproxy can process them, can be missed as
they will be overwritten by the Router_info class manipulating other
rules in the same 'nat' rules list.

This patch fixed that by adding lock for methods which are changing
rules in iptables_manager's nat table in both router_info and
the metadata agent's driver.

Conflicts:
    neutron/agent/metadata/driver.py

Closes-Bug: #1920778
Change-Id: Ic3a324c0e608c7afc4b15dbc8becd33b75ee78f6
(cherry picked from commit af3c1b84427cbe4c9d3dce8fc901ad0b099c5917)
(cherry picked from commit c028839647d6900997cf38b5eec63b7698515dec)

(cherry picked from commit c028839647d6900997cf38b5eec63b7698515dec)
(cherry picked from commit 7af0b713ff21e27889f7b322b736cab4b0dadaf9)
"}]
commit_message:
Add locks for setting iptables rules in l3 and metadata agents

Router_info class and metadata agent's driver are using same
instance of the iptables manager class and it could happend that
sometimes e.g. nat rule which packets send to 169.254.169.254:80
redirects to the port 9697 so haproxy can process them, can be missed as
they will be overwritten by the Router_info class manipulating other
rules in the same 'nat' rules list.

This patch fixed that by adding lock for methods which are changing
rules in iptables_manager's nat table in both router_info and
the metadata agent's driver.

Conflicts:
    neutron/agent/metadata/driver.py

Closes-Bug: #1920778
Change-Id: Ic3a324c0e608c7afc4b15dbc8becd33b75ee78f6
(cherry picked from commit af3c1b84427cbe4c9d3dce8fc901ad0b099c5917)
(cherry picked from commit c028839647d6900997cf38b5eec63b7698515dec)
(cherry picked from commit 7af0b713ff21e27889f7b322b736cab4b0dadaf9)

On older distros, enable fewer features by default.

commit_message:
Set RBD default features based on distro

In some jobs, we run tests that use "rbd map".
On older kernels, this will not work if newer
RBD features are used.  (Specifically, fast-diff
on bionic.)

On older distros, enable fewer features by default.

Closes-Bug: #1921897
Change-Id: Iff1c5210b0279379eb9612b206bdf456dd6f132e
(cherry picked from commit 35e1ff5cf4a50594578ab8d13499789c2ccef351)
(cherry picked from commit 3db789ae6c0e53b593ba5932c8177e0238f2d443)
(cherry picked from commit fe4c6269f99ac27851040df40634ecb37db540fd)
(cherry picked from commit 00fd7f31217f07a71567d82fae366efc94c159b4)

messages: [{'account_id': 22477, 'date': '2021-04-20 19:10:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 21991, 'date': '2021-04-20 19:13:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2021-04-20 19:14:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\nAs discussed in IRC, also similar to how the OpenStack release managers are handling their own branch deletions recently.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-20 19:10:42.000000000', 'message': 'Add ACL rule for deleting treasuremap branches

This grants delete privileges on Treasuremap project branches to the
airship-release group.  This is required so that we can clean up the
old `v2` branch now that its contents have been moved to master, and
is no longer needed (and can be confusing).

Change-Id: I052401ba1932f821f0825fa7047576a119cee1ed
'}]
commit_message:
Add ACL rule for deleting treasuremap branches

This grants delete privileges on Treasuremap project branches to the
airship-release group.  This is required so that we can clean up the
old `v2` branch now that its contents have been moved to master, and
is no longer needed (and can be confusing).

Change-Id: I052401ba1932f821f0825fa7047576a119cee1ed

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-19 23:00:43.000000000', 'message': 'Fix stream arg validation

Now that args.stream is always true, the validation must take into
account whether args.no_stream is set. Without this validation will
always fail on non-stream distros.

Change-Id: I2d1f2f6d72e8ebbec69885faf825f0aee8afbbfc
'}]
commit_message:
Fix stream arg validation

Now that args.stream is always true, the validation must take into
account whether args.no_stream is set. Without this validation will
always fail on non-stream distros.

Change-Id: I2d1f2f6d72e8ebbec69885faf825f0aee8afbbfc

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-21 21:13:12.000000000', 'message': "Allow unsupported redfish set_boot_mode

Currently if the baremetal boot mode is unknown and the driver doesn't
support setting the boot mode then the error is logged and deployment
continues.

However if the BMC doesn't support getting or setting the boot mode
then setting the boot mode raises an error which results in the deploy
failing. This is the case for HPE Gen9 baremetal, which doesn't have a
'BootSourceOverrideMode' attribute in its system Boot field, and
raises a 400 iLO.2.14.UnsupportedOperation in response to setting the
boot mode.

This is raised from set_boot_mode as a RedfishError. This change
raises UnsupportedDriverExtension exception when the 'mode' attribute
is missing from the 'boot' field, allowing the deployment to continue.

Change-Id: I360ff8180be252de21f5fcd2208947087e332a39
(cherry picked from commit 9f221a7d42350f38bc502c1fd79232593cff7ab2)
"}]
commit_message:
Allow unsupported redfish set_boot_mode

Currently if the baremetal boot mode is unknown and the driver doesn't
support setting the boot mode then the error is logged and deployment
continues.

However if the BMC doesn't support getting or setting the boot mode
then setting the boot mode raises an error which results in the deploy
failing. This is the case for HPE Gen9 baremetal, which doesn't have a
'BootSourceOverrideMode' attribute in its system Boot field, and
raises a 400 iLO.2.14.UnsupportedOperation in response to setting the
boot mode.

This is raised from set_boot_mode as a RedfishError. This change
raises UnsupportedDriverExtension exception when the 'mode' attribute
is missing from the 'boot' field, allowing the deployment to continue.

Change-Id: I360ff8180be252de21f5fcd2208947087e332a39
(cherry picked from commit 9f221a7d42350f38bc502c1fd79232593cff7ab2)

commit_message:
Use py3 as the default runtime for tox

Moving on py3 as the default runtime for tox to avoid to update this at
each new cycle.

Wallaby support officially the following runtimes [1]:
- Python 3.6
- Python 3.8

During Victoria Python 3.7 was used as the default runtime [2] however this
version isn't longer officially supported.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/wallaby.html#python-runtimes-for-wallaby
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/victoria.html#python-runtimes-for-victoria

Change-Id: I2c5e92944ca38ca72b3d25041d2ef6bca13cbc51

* added base structure for the docs
* used sphinx-material theme for docs with some modifications
* copy-pasted some outdated pages and pictures from rally framework docs
* included changelog
* added zuul job for building docs
* changed docs of expected system enviroment varibales of
  existing@openstack env plugin.

commit_message:
Set RBD default features based on distro

In some jobs, we run tests that use "rbd map".
On older kernels, this will not work if newer
RBD features are used.  (Specifically, fast-diff
on bionic.)

On older distros, enable fewer features by default.

Closes-Bug: #1921897
Change-Id: Iff1c5210b0279379eb9612b206bdf456dd6f132e
(cherry picked from commit 35e1ff5cf4a50594578ab8d13499789c2ccef351)
(cherry picked from commit 3db789ae6c0e53b593ba5932c8177e0238f2d443)
(cherry picked from commit fe4c6269f99ac27851040df40634ecb37db540fd)

commit_message:
Limit access to sshd used for nova migration

Previously access to the sshd running by the nova-migration-target
container is only limited via the sshd_config. While login is
not possible from other networks, the service is reachable via
all networks. This change limits the access to the NovaLibvirt
and NovaApi networks which are used for cold and live-migration.

Conflicts:
  deployment/nova/nova-migration-target-container-puppet.yaml

Change-Id: Ie868463143af66c7004dbcacefde76ca0977880e
(cherry picked from commit c04c9b0d701abb91ddacf0fd5320899d907e6cf1)
(cherry picked from commit 85e89060b74d81baaf101b009bea44b93389f9a3)

commit_message:
Limit access to sshd used for nova migration

Previously access to the sshd running by the nova-migration-target
container is only limited via the sshd_config. While login is
not possible from other networks, the service is reachable via
all networks. This change limits the access to the NovaLibvirt
and NovaApi networks which are used for cold and live-migration.

Change-Id: Ie868463143af66c7004dbcacefde76ca0977880e
(cherry picked from commit c04c9b0d701abb91ddacf0fd5320899d907e6cf1)

oslo_config.cfg.NoSuchOptError: no such option volume_encryption in group [DEFAULT]'}, {'account_id': 20813, 'date': '2020-08-06 18:31:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 18058, 'date': '2020-08-07 16:04:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(5 comments)

Thank you for working on this, Sofia. Please check some nits inline.

Also, the tests are failing [0] with the following message:

> Details: {'code': 400, 'message': "Invalid volume: Volume 190eec97-97cd-4a3e-af74-83a9e80a0619 status must be '{'status': 'available'}' to extend, currently in-use."}

Seems that the tests are using a microversion that still doesn't support the online extend feature. It got supported starting from 3.42 [1].

I think there're no test cases in cinder-tempest-plugin that specifies API version, yet.
Manila project folks solved similar problems in the manila-tempest-plugin tests [2][3] by specifying the share API version to be used. We might take it as an example.

Alternatively, we could specify volume.min_microversion=3.42 in tempest.conf, but it would leave older microversions untested.

[0] https://ed1f31f8cb968641f418-9c70d0e7f65ac2a140f331474bd3c7ee.ssl.cf1.rackcdn.com/742943/3/check/cinder-tempest-plugin-basic-train/4703ed8/testr_results.html
[1] https://docs.openstack.org/cinder/latest/contributor/api_microversion_history.html#id40
[2] https://github.com/openstack/manila-tempest-plugin/blob/master/manila_tempest_tests/services/share/v2/json/shares_client.py#L47_L56
[3] https://github.com/openstack/manila-tempest-plugin/blob/master/manila_tempest_tests/tests/api/admin/test_snapshot_manage.py#L154_L155'}, {'account_id': 18058, 'date': '2020-08-12 16:11:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Extend while attached volume

Adding two tests scenarios for extending bootable volumes in Cinder.

Co-Authored-By: Benny Kopilov <bkopilov@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I3b7f2b4a7bfad96e8623d2c895d09815e4069c9c

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-14 08:27:41.000000000', 'message': "Update cirros default version

New version of cirros is used by default and it's breaking grenade job.
Updating the default version should fix that.

Change-Id: Ic7f5dae5e6aa6916f0a7d73f43cc9552349385c5
"}, {'created': '2021-04-15 07:52:59.000000000', 'message': 'Drop conflicting custom cirros version variable

The CIRROS_VERSION is handled by devstack directly.
In case we need a different version the proper way to configure it is to
set the CIRROS_VERSION value in the job as devstack variable.

Change-Id: Ic7f5dae5e6aa6916f0a7d73f43cc9552349385c5
'}, {'created': '2021-04-15 10:20:40.000000000', 'message': 'Drop conflicting custom cirros version variable

The CIRROS_VERSION is handled by devstack directly.
In case we need a different version the proper way to configure it is to
set the CIRROS_VERSION value in the job as devstack variable.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/ironic/+/786387

Change-Id: Ic7f5dae5e6aa6916f0a7d73f43cc9552349385c5
'}, {'created': '2021-04-15 15:10:11.000000000', 'message': 'Read default cirros version from stackrc

Workaround for grenade jobs to read CIRROS_VERSION variable from
stackrc.
We also give the possibility to specify a custom CIRROS_VERSION

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/ironic/+/786387

Change-Id: Ic7f5dae5e6aa6916f0a7d73f43cc9552349385c5
'}, {'created': '2021-04-19 17:47:11.000000000', 'message': 'Read default cirros version from stackrc

Workaround for grenade jobs to read CIRROS_VERSION variable from
stackrc.
We also give the possibility to specify a custom CIRROS_VERSION

In addition, fix transient iDRAC WS-Man BIOS test.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/ironic/+/786387

Change-Id: Ic7f5dae5e6aa6916f0a7d73f43cc9552349385c5
'}]
commit_message:
Read default cirros version from stackrc

Workaround for grenade jobs to read CIRROS_VERSION variable from
stackrc.
We also give the possibility to specify a custom CIRROS_VERSION

In addition, fix transient iDRAC WS-Man BIOS test.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/ironic/+/786387

Change-Id: Ic7f5dae5e6aa6916f0a7d73f43cc9552349385c5

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-27 02:05:49.000000000', 'message': "[goal] Deprecate the JSON formatted policy file

As per the community goal of migrating the policy file
the format from JSON to YAML[1], we need to do two things:

1. Change the default value of '[oslo_policy] policy_file''
config option from 'policy.json' to 'policy.yaml' with
upgrade checks.

2. Deprecate the JSON formatted policy file on the project side
via warning in doc and releasenotes.

Also replace policy.json to policy.yaml ref from doc and tests.

[1]https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/wallaby/migrate-policy-format-from-json-to-yaml.html

Change-Id: Ia7365cc3ae09e2ff916ab9f9ff0ba4fef0dc446b

commit_message:
[goal] Deprecate the JSON formatted policy file

As per the community goal of migrating the policy file
the format from JSON to YAML[1], we need to do two things:

1. Change the default value of '[oslo_policy] policy_file''
config option from 'policy.json' to 'policy.yaml' with
upgrade checks.

2. Deprecate the JSON formatted policy file on the project side
via warning in doc and releasenotes.

Also replace policy.json to policy.yaml ref from doc and tests.

[1]https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/wallaby/migrate-policy-format-from-json-to-yaml.html

Change-Id: Ia7365cc3ae09e2ff916ab9f9ff0ba4fef0dc446b

commit_message:
Implement WEBSSO redirect

This patch adds ability to configure horizon auto redirections when
WEBSSO is used.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible/+/785800
Change-Id: I2a1beddaed3a31d1c01d1310dc8b739c9c93d9dd
Closes-Bug: #1922687

[{'created': '2021-04-19 20:03:00.000000000', 'message': 'Use CephRgwCertificateKeySize, not CephCertificateKeySize, for RGW

When using key_size_override_unset to choose either CertificateKeySize
or CephRgwCertificateKeySize, base the setting of the condition
key_size_override_unset on if CephRgwCertificateKeySize is empty,
not on if CephCertificateKeySize is empty.

Closes-Bug: #1925069
Change-Id: Iac4a4424a21af0ab851e387a381747c413621009
'}]
commit_message:
Use CephRgwCertificateKeySize, not CephCertificateKeySize, for RGW

When using key_size_override_unset to choose either CertificateKeySize
or CephRgwCertificateKeySize, base the setting of the condition
key_size_override_unset on if CephRgwCertificateKeySize is empty,
not on if CephCertificateKeySize is empty.

Closes-Bug: #1925069
Change-Id: Iac4a4424a21af0ab851e387a381747c413621009

commit_message:
Add haproxy prometheus/alertmanager endpoint for Ceph Dashboard

This change adds the prometheus and alertmanager endpoints which
are on the same grafana network and allow us to just use a single
vip to access the prometheus and alertmanager instances from the
ceph dashboard when enabled.
We already did it for grafana [1] and we would like to do the same
for prometheus and alertmanager.

[1] https://github.com/ceph/ceph-ansible/blob/master/roles/ceph-dashboard/tasks/configure_dashboard.yml#L192

Change-Id: I0dbcde302a3abdfccc3dd996b1c238e25064dd12

commit_message:
Restrict syncing of boot mode to Supermicro

The fix for https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2008252 synced
the boot mode after changing the boot device, because Supermicro nodes
reset the boot mode if not included in the boot device set. However this
can cause a problem on Dell nodes when changing the mode uefi->bios or
bios->uefi. Restrict the syncing of the boot mode to Supermicro.

Story: 2008712
Task: 42046
Change-Id: I9f305cb3f33766c1c93cf4347368b1ce025fc635
(cherry picked from commit 8bd25a9882e64ae378974e974c39b874d4b9b0e8)

commit_message:
Update to not use deprecated `get_task_monitor`.

`update_service.get_task_monitor` is deprecated, using
top level `get_task_monitor` instead.

Change-Id: Ib028313ee14744a2c016ebaa463e6bfc3a4cc5f0

commit_message:
For Supermicro BMCs set enable when changing boot device

When setting the boot settings on Supermicro BMCs, the
BootSourceOverrideEnabled must be set to the desired
value whenever the BootSourceOverrideTarget is set or
it will revert to the default value (Once).  This is
different than what is currently implemented for other
BMCs in which the BootSourceOverrideEnabled is not set
if it matches the current setting.

This change uses the vendor setting to determine if it's
a Supermicro BMC.

Story: 2008547
Task: 41652

Change-Id: I1b1a6baafd4cc4daa2fbdb82f69ded6253b1fcbf
(cherry picked from commit 4a7d50ce56b88c82e95665ac6df44666d3e647ed)
(cherry picked from commit 7d74ea0eee8f935f5b6c8406e6997d4143fce01e)

commit_message:
[OVN] Explicitly set grenade job to ML2/OVS

Devstack is changing the Neutron default to OVN backend. For the grenade
job we need to wait until the stable branch is deployed with OVN so that
we can upgrade it to master.

Change-Id: I51f0273e90ee39d644cf85a0bdb9d4f95de6d3c7
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Restrict syncing of boot mode to Supermicro

The fix for https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2008252 synced
the boot mode after changing the boot device, because Supermicro nodes
reset the boot mode if not included in the boot device set. However this
can cause a problem on Dell nodes when changing the mode uefi->bios or
bios->uefi. Restrict the syncing of the boot mode to Supermicro.

Story: 2008712
Task: 42046
Change-Id: I9f305cb3f33766c1c93cf4347368b1ce025fc635
(cherry picked from commit 8bd25a9882e64ae378974e974c39b874d4b9b0e8)
(cherry picked from commit 72fd48b9cb9593dc864de05c4f8ff48829024689)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-13 01:15:13.000000000', 'message': "Refactor vendor detection and add Redfish implementation

Get rid of the TODO in the code and prepare for more management
interfaces supporting detect_vendor(). Vendor detecting now runs
during transition to manageable and on power state sync (essentially
same as before but for all drivers not only IPMI).

Update the IPMI implementation to no longer hide exceptions since
they're not handled on the upper level. Simplify the regex and fix
the docstring.

Add the Redfish implementation as a foundation for future
vendor-specific changes.

commit_message:
Refactor vendor detection and add Redfish implementation

Get rid of the TODO in the code and prepare for more management
interfaces supporting detect_vendor(). Vendor detecting now runs
during transition to manageable and on power state sync (essentially
same as before but for all drivers not only IPMI).

Update the IPMI implementation to no longer hide exceptions since
they're not handled on the upper level. Simplify the regex and fix
the docstring.

Add the Redfish implementation as a foundation for future
vendor-specific changes.

Change-Id: Ie521cf2295613dde5842cbf9a053540a40be4b9c
(cherry picked from commit 121b3348c813eb075ca38bd264a9315ee3acc2fe)
(cherry picked from commit 4df73e47e1042dcd3cc693520cf63712df0bb875)

commit_message:
nova_flavor: Accept array format about access_project_ids

The latest openstackclient doesn't show none but empty array([]) when
no access_project_ids is set for an flavor.
This change ensure that array format is properly handled to avoid
error during updating nova flavor using the nova_flavor resource.

Closes-Bug: #1924222
Change-Id: I976f70f1f4015536201c6c3acac3f1e4dbca4ccb

commit_message:
For Supermicro BMCs set enable when changing boot device

When setting the boot settings on Supermicro BMCs, the
BootSourceOverrideEnabled must be set to the desired
value whenever the BootSourceOverrideTarget is set or
it will revert to the default value (Once).  This is
different than what is currently implemented for other
BMCs in which the BootSourceOverrideEnabled is not set
if it matches the current setting.

This change uses the vendor setting to determine if it's
a Supermicro BMC.

Story: 2008547
Task: 41652

Change-Id: I1b1a6baafd4cc4daa2fbdb82f69ded6253b1fcbf
(cherry picked from commit 4a7d50ce56b88c82e95665ac6df44666d3e647ed)
(cherry picked from commit 7d74ea0eee8f935f5b6c8406e6997d4143fce01e)
(cherry picked from commit 2e4e8755680080fca2a31adf7a1dfec7b1c10d0a)

commit_message:
Use a more targeted job for tripleo-validations

* using multinode jobs for validations is too heavy
and uses too much resources
* remove standalone004 - worthless sans rpm build
* add a validations job that targets validations

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/python-tripleoclient/+/786425
Change-Id: Ifef837dc884c7338f9396214e36a197cdbb060c6
